info.title: Contact Center
info.description: The Contact Center APIs allow developers to interface with [Contact Center](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/contact-center/) features programmatically.

get.description:
Return a list of all address books. 

 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_contact:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:read:list_address_books:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items returned per page.

parameters.name: unit_id
parameters.description: The address book unit's ID.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`   
 
 Address books list returned.

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

total_contacts.description: The address book's total number of contacts.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `1902`
The `unit_id` field cannot be an empty value.

Not Found **Error Code:** `1901`
Unit does not exist: $unitId.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Create an [address book](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4471544949389). An address book is a collection of consumer information like display names, phone numbers, and locations. 

 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_contact:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:write:address_book:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `1902`
The `unit_id` field cannot be an empty value.
**Error Code:** `1903`
The `address_book_name` field cannot be an empty value.
**Error Code:** `2003`
The address book name is not supported.
**Error Code:** `2002`
Address book already exists.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `1901`
Unit does not exist: $unitId.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.summary: List an address book's custom fields
get.description:
Return all address book custom fields.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_contact:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:read:address_book_custom_field:admin`

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items returned per page.

200.description: The address book's custom fields list is returned.

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

custom_fields.description: Information about the address book custom fields.

data_type.description:
The custom field's data type.

string
number
boolean
email
phone - E.164 format
percent
currency
dateTime - unix timestamp
pick_list

pick_list_values.description: Specify the list of supported values for the picklist. This is only valid when data_type is pick_list.

address_books.description: The address books associated with the custom field.

use_as_routing_profile_parameter.description: Whether or not to use the custom fields in the consumer routing profile.

use_as_external_url_parameter.description:
Whether or not to use the `custom_field_name` in defining external URLs launched for each engagement.
When set to `true`, the `custom_field_name` should not contain any spaces.

show_in_transferred_calls.description: Whether or not to show the custom fields in calls transferred to Zoom Phone.

show_in_inbound_notification.description: Whether or not to show the custom fields on the inbound engagement notification in the Zoom client.

show_in_profile_tab.description: Whether or not to show the custom fields on the profile tab in the Zoom client.

Bad Request

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `300`
Invalid field.
**Error Code:** `2107`
A custom field with this name already exists: $custom_field_name
**Error Code:** `2108`
The data type provided for the custom field is not supported.
**Error Code:** `2109`
The default value format does not match the data type.
**Error Code:** `2110`
Maximum limit of 4096 custom fields has been exceeded.
**Error Code:** `2111`
Custom field name cannot contain spaces when use_as_external_url_parameter is true.
**Error Code:** `2115`
Invalid default value. The provided value is not in the list of supported picklist values.

get.description:
When the `emails` or `phone_numbers` query parameter is included, the address book returns a maximum of 10,000 contacts.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_contact:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:read:list_address_book_contacts:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: addressBookId
parameters.description: The address book's ID.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items returned per page.

parameters.name: emails
parameters.description: The contact's email address. Multiple emails can be searched. Only an exact match is supported. Accomodates a maximum of 10 emails.

parameters.name: phone_numbers
parameters.description: The contact's phone number. Multiple phone numbers can be searched, Only an exact match is supported. Accomodates a maximum of 10 phone numbers.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

items.description: Supports up to 5 phone numbers. Only one main phone number is supported.

timezone.description: The contact's time zone. Refer to this list for supported [timezones](/docs/api/references/abbreviations/#timezones).

consumer_ids.description: The consumer IDs associated with the contact.

custom_fields_url.description:
The URL to retrieve contact's custom field list, if the contact custom fields exists. 
For security purposes, you must provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to to retrieve contact's custom field list using this URL. Example:
curl --request GET 
 --url {custom_fields_url} 
 --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' 
 --header 'content-type: application/json'

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `300`
Number of phone numbers exceeds max limit of 10
**Error Code:** `300`
Number of emails exceeds max limit of 10
**Error Code:** `300`
Invalid phone number
**Error Code:** `300`
Invalid email

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `2001`

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests For more information, see [rate limits](/docs/api/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Create a new contact in an [address book](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4471544949389). During an active engagement, the Zoom desktop client will display information from the address book if that customer is a contact in the address book. If the consumer is not in the address book, agents can add a new contact and choose which address book the contact belongs to. 

 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_contact:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:write:address_book_contact:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: addressBookId
parameters.description: The address book's ID.

phone_numbers.description: The contact's phone numbers. You must provide this field and/or the `email` field when you create a contact.

items.description: Supports up to 5 phone numbers. Only one main phone number is supported.

emails.description: The contact's email addresses. You must provide either this field or the `phone_numbers` field, or both, when you create a contact.

timezone.description: The contact's time zone. Refer to this list for supported [timezones](/docs/api/references/abbreviations/#timezones).

consumer_ids.description: The consumer IDs to be associated with the contact.

custom_fields.description: Information about address book's custom fields.

items.description: Supports up to 5 phone numbers. Only one main phone number is supported.

timezone.description: The contact's time zone. Refer to this list for supported [timezones](/docs/api/references/abbreviations/#timezones).

consumer_ids.description: The consumer IDs associated with the contact.

custom_fields_url.description:
The URL to retrieve contact's custom field list, if the contact custom fields exists. 
For security purposes, you must provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to to retrieve contact's custom field list using this URL. Example:
curl --request GET 
 --url {custom_fields_url} 
 --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' 
 --header 'content-type: application/json'

**Error Code:** `300`

parameters.description: The number of items returned per page.

parameters.description:
The status's category.

* `agent_status` - User's system statuses.

* `queue_opt_out_and_not_ready_status` - User's **Queue Opt-Out** and **Not Ready** reasons. **Not Ready** reasons are referenced by field `sub_status_name` in the Users APIs, such as [List users' profiles](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/contact-center/apis/#operation/users).

status_name.description:
The user's [availability status](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4470584918541-Setting-availability-status). 
* Offline. 
* Ready. 
* Not Ready. 
* Occupied. 
* A custom user status, like **Lunch**.

* `agent_status` - User's system statuses.

* `queue_opt_out_and_not_ready_status` - User's **Queue Opt-Out** and **Not Ready** reasons. **Not Ready** reasons are referenced by field `sub_status_name` in the Users APIs, such as [List users' profiles](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/contact-center/apis/#operation/users).

enable.description: Only applicable to a status with the `queue_opt_out_and_not_ready_status` category. If enabled, the agent can set the status as a sub-status for **Not Ready** or **Queue Opt Out**.

status_assigned_queues.description: Information about the queues that are using the 'Not Ready' or opt out of queue status.

post.description:
Create a asset.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_asset_library:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:write:asset_library:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

asset_items.description:
A list of the asset's items.

### Restriction
Each item must have a different `asset_item_language`, and only one item can have a `is_default` set to `true`.

upload_file.description:
The uploaded file in binary format. 
Only works for `asset_type`s `audio`, `image`, `video` and `slides`.

This field is not required if you create a TTS item when creating or updating an audio asset.

### Allowed file extension

- audio : mp3, wav
- image : jpeg, jpg, jpe, jif, jfif, png, gif
- slides : pdf
- video : mp4, mov

### Maximum filesize support

A single request can upload a maximum of 100MB.
Single file maximum filesize: 
- audio : 10M
- image : 10M
- slides : 10M
- video : 100M

asset_item_content.description:
The asset item's content.
Only works for `asset_type`s `text` and `saved_reply`.

is_default.description: Whether this item is the default of the asset. Each asset can only have one `isDefault` set to `true`.

asset_item_voice.description:
The asset item's text-to-speech voice. It only works for the audio type. When you want to create a TTS asset item, need to fill in the `asset_item_file_url` and `asset_item_content`, but don't need to fill in the `upload_file` field. asset_item_id.description:

If it is used to update the asset item, carrying this field indicates an update. Otherwise, it indicates adding an asset item.

is_default.description: Whether this item is the asset's default. Each asset can only have one `isDefault` set to `true`.

patch.description:
Update an asset.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_asset_library:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:write:asset_library:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: assetId
parameters.description: The asset's ID.

asset_items.description:
A list of the asset's items.

**Restriction**
Each item must have a different `asset_item_language`, and only one item can have a `is_default` set to `true`.

If this field is not filled in, it means no modifications will be made to the asset items. 
If this field is filled in, the provided data will overwrite the current asset items. 
To update an existing asset item, fill in the `asset_item_id`. Otherwise, it will be considered adding a new asset item.

This API can only update or add asset items, not delete them.

asset_item_id.description:
The asset item's ID.
If it is used to update the asset item, carrying this field indicates an update; otherwise, it indicates adding an asset item.

upload_file.description:
The uploaded file, in binary format. 
Only works for `asset_type`s `audio`, `image`, `video` and `slides`.

This field is not required if you create a TTS item when creating or updating an audio asset.

**Allowed file extensions**
* audio - mp3, wav
* image - jpeg, jpg, jpe, jif, jfif, png, gif
* slides - pdf
* video - mp4, mov

**Maximum supported filesize**
A single request can upload a maximum of 100MB.
**Single file maximum filesize**
* audio - 10M
* image - 10M
* slides - 10M
* video - 100M

asset_item_content.description:
The asset item's content.
Only works for `asset_type`s `text` and `saved_reply`.

is_default.description: Whether this item is the default of the asset. Each asset can only have one `isDefault` set to `true`.

asset_item_voice.description:
The asset item's text-to-speech voice. It only works for the audio type. When you want to create a TTS asset item, need to fill in the `asset_item_file_url` and `asset_item_content`, but don't need to fill in the `upload_file` field. Not every language supports TTS, and each language has a different voice. | asset_item_language | asset_item_voice | |---------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | yue-CN | Hiujin | | cmn-CN | Zhiyu | | da-DK | Naja

put.description:
Controls the recording state for an engagement.

This request is only valid for video and voice engagements. Calling this API for other channel types is invalid.

Acceptance of a request and response of `HTTP 204 No Content` only ensures there were no validation errors with the request.

**Note:** The **Control an engagement's recording** API only works with third-party apps if the account admin has enabled the **Allow Open API to pause and resume automatic call recording** setting. For more details, refer to this [support article](https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0059069).

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_engagement:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:update:engagement_recording_control:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: engagementId
parameters.description: The engagement event's unique ID.

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The command for the recording control.

204.description: **HTTP Status:** `204` **No Content** Request accepted for processing with no validation errors. This does not imply successful execution of the command.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `2814`
Cannot use this recording control command with this engagement's channel type.
**Error Code:** `2815`
The engagement is not assigned to an agent. It is not being recorded.
**Error Code:** `2818`
Cannot change recording state from {current_state} to {command_state}.
**Error Code:** `2819`
Recording is stopped.
**Error Code:** `2808`
Recording is in progress. There is no need to open it again.
**Error Code:** `2809`
Start recording first. Cannot be converted to {state}.
**Error Code:** `2810`
No need to repeat the operation. The current state is already {state}.
**Error Code:** `2812`
The recording control's current state is {current_state}, and it cannot be converted to {command_state}.
**Error Code:** `300`
Invalid request.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `20006`
Account not found.
**Error Code:** `2816`
The system could not find the session for the engagement.
**Error Code:** `2817`
There is no recording for this engagement.
**Error Code:** `2901`
Engagement does not exist: {0}.
**Error Code:** `2906`
There are no agents on the call.

409.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `409`
Conflict **Error Code:** `2907`
There was a problem processing the recording control request.
**Error Code:** `2908`
The operation was partially completed. Try again.
**Error Code:** `2909`
There was a problem processing the recording control request.

**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](/docs/api/rate-limits/).

channel.description: The channel type. Currently only supports `voice`.

device_id.description: The device ID. Only valid and `Required` when `channel` is `voice`.

cc_queue_id.description: The Contact Center queue's ID. `Required` when `command` is `make_call`.

queue_caller_id_number.description: The queue's caller ID number, in E.164 format, configured inside the queue. Only valid and `Optional` when `command` is `make_call`.

consumer_number.description: The customer's phone number. Only valid and `Required` when `command` is `make_call`.

post.description:
Create an outbound Contact Center campaign.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_outbound_campaign:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:write:outbound_campaign:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

outbound_campaign_name.description: The campaign's name. Names are a unique key among all outbound campaigns.

queue_id.description:
1 - Only voice queues configured for outbound engagements with at least one user from Zoom Contact Center Premium or Elite packages are available for selection.
2 - Queue distribution cannot be configured to Simultaneous or Do Not Distribute.

phone_number_id.description: The reference ID for the Contact Center phone number. This number is displayed to consumers for outbound calls.

dialing_method.description:
The dialer method determines how contacts in this campaign will be dialed.
"progressive": engagement details are displayed to the agent **after** they are connected with the consumer.
"preview": engagement details are displayed to the agent **before** they are connected with the consumer.

dialing_method_settings.description: One of either Progressive or Preview dialing.

enable_amd.description:
Enable Answering Machine Detection (AMD). Use this action to detect an answering machine for calls to consumers.

When AMD is enabled, the following default configurations are set:
- A person answers: disconnect the call. Optionally, provide an asset id for an asset to play before connecting the call to an agent.
- An answering machine answers: disconnect the call. Optionally, provide an asset id for an asset to play after the tone and before disconnecting.
- A FAX machine answers: disconnect the call.

Note: Enabling Answering Machine Detection may increase the connection time between an agent and a consumer, due to the necessity to analyze the audio stream.

By enabling answering machine detection, you acknowledge that you are responsible for ensuring that your use of this technology complies with local laws and regulations.

greeting_asset_id.description: The Contact Center Asset Library asset to play when a consumer answers the call, before the agent is connected.

answering_machine_asset_id.description: The Contact Center Asset Library asset to play when an answering machine is detected.

amd_settings.description: Answering Machine Detection (AMD) settings. Use with `enable_amd`.

enable_abandonment_timeout.description: Abandon answered calls if an agent does not connect within a set period of time.

abandonment_timeout.description:
Use with `enable_abandonment_timeout`. If `enable_abandonment_timeout` is false, this will be set to null.
A call connected to a consumer will be abandoned if an agent does not connect before the abandonment timeout has elapsed. Abandonment timeout must be between 2 and 30 seconds.

abandonment_message_asset_id.description: Use with `enable_abandonment_timeout`. The Contact Center Asset Library asset to play when a call is abandoned due to agent unavailability.

dialing_strategy.description:
Use with the Preview dialing method. 
Automatic connects calls automatically. Manual allows the agent to dial the calls manually.

preview_timer.description: Displays timer before call is initiated automatically.

enable_skip.description: Preview dialing method only. Allow agent to skip outbound engagements.

max_skips.description: Preview dialing method only. Configure skip reasons under **Contact Center Preferences**.

enable_ignore_preview_notification.description: Preview dialing method only. Ignoring will automatically update the agent's status based on the Auto Update Status settings in **Contact Center Preferences**.

campaign_contact_list_ids.description:
Contacts will be dialed in alphabetical order. If a contact has more than one phone number, the numbers will be dialed in the order they are listed until a call is connected or all numbers have been tried.

A list of contact list ids to dial with this campaign. Multiple contact lists can be input here.

**Leave this blank to use this campaign with the outbound dialer API.**

items.description: Contact list ids. These can be retrieved using the [List campaign contact lists API.](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/campaign/GET/contact_center/outbound_campaign/contact_lists)

enable_max_ring_time.description: Disconnect unanswered calls after a set period of time has elapsed.

max_ring_time.description: Use with `enable_max_ring_time`. A call is considered unanswered after the maximum ring time has elapsed. Maximum ring time must be between 15 and 120 seconds.

business_hour_source.description: The Contact Center business hour source. Select `queue` to use the outbound queue's business hours, and `campaign` to set custom hours. Defaults to `queue`.

business_hour_id.description:
The Contact Center business hours ID. The campaign will only dial during these hours.
[Create business hours API.](/docs/contact-center/apis/#operation/businessHourCreate)

enable_closure_hour.description: Toggle closure hours on or off. Outbound calls are not started during closure hours.

closure_set_id.description:
The Contact Center closure hours ID.
[Create closure hours API.](/docs/contact-center/apis/#operation/closuresSetCreate)

contact_timezone_source.description:
Determine the source used to establish the contact's timezone for deciding appropriate calling hours (9 AM to 5 PM).

**Valid values**

`none` - Disables timezone-based calling restrictions. Calls can be made at any time.

`timezone` - Uses the contact's explicit timezone attribute to determine calling eligibility.

`area_code` - Derives the timezone based on the area code of the contact's highest priority phone number according to the dial order.

assign_type.description:
Phone number type.
* 1 - Queue Caller ID
* 2 - Account Default Caller ID
* 3 - Customer Caller ID
* 4 - Automatic Caller ID

201.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `201`     Outbound campaign is created.

outbound_campaign_name.description: The campaign's name. Names are a unique key among all outbound campaigns.

queue_id.description: 1 - Only voice queues configured for outbound engagements with at least one user from Zoom Contact Center Premium or Elite packages are available for selection.\n2 - Queue distribution cannot be configured to Simultaneous or Do Not Distribute.

phone_number_id.description: The reference ID for the Contact Center phone number. This number is displayed to consumers for outbound calls.

dialing_method.description: The dialer method determines how contacts in this campaign will be dialed.\nProgressive: engagement details are displayed to the agent **after** they are connected with the consumer.\nPreview: engagement details are displayed to the agent **before** they are connected with the consumer.

dialing_method_settings.description: One of either Progressive or Preview dialing.

enable_amd.description:
Enable Answering Machine Detection (AMD). Use this action to detect an answering machine for calls to consumers.

When AMD is enabled, these default configurations are set.
* A person answers - disconnect the call. Optionally, provide an asset id for an asset to play before connecting the call to an agent.
* An answering machine answers - disconnect the call. Optionally, provide an asset id for an asset to play after the tone and before disconnecting.
* A FAX machine answers - disconnect the call.

Note: Enabling answering machine detection may increase the connection time between an agent and a consumer, due to the necessity to analyze the audio stream.

By enabling answering machine detection, you acknowledge that you are responsible for ensuring that your use of this technology complies with local laws and regulations.

greeting_asset_id.description: The Contact Center Asset Library asset to play when a consumer answers the call, before the agent is connected.

answering_machine_asset_id.description: The Contact Center Asset Library asset to play when an answering machine is detected.

amd_settings.description: Answering Machine Detection (AMD) settings. Use with `enable_amd`.

enable_abandonment_timeout.description: Abandon answered calls if an agent does not connect within a set period of time.

abandonment_timeout.description:
Use with `enable_abandonment_timeout`. If `enable_abandonment_timeout` is false, then this will be set to null.
A call connected to a consumer will be abandoned if an agent does not connect before the abandonment timeout has elapsed. Abandonment timeout must be between 2 and 30 seconds.

abandonment_message_asset_id.description: Use with `enable_abandonment`. The Contact Center Asset Library asset to play when a call is abandoned due to agent unavailability.

dialing_strategy.description:
Use with the Preview dialing method. 
Automatic connects calls automatically. Manual allows the agent to dial the calls manually.

preview_timer.description: Displays timer before call is initiated automatically.

enable_skip.description: Preview dialing method only. Allow agent to skip outbound engagements.

max_skips.description: Preview dialing method only. Configure skip reasons under **Contact Center Preferences**.

enable_ignore_preview_notification.description: Preview dialing method only. Ignoring will automatically update the agent's status based on the **Auto Update Status** settings in **Contact Center Preferences**.

campaign_contact_list.description:
Contacts will be dialed in alphabetical order. If a contact has more than one phone number, the numbers will be dialed in the order they are listed until a call is connected or all numbers have been tried.

A list of contact list ids to dial with this campaign. Multiple contact lists can be input here.

**Leave this blank to use this campaign with the outbound dialer API.**

contacts_count.description: Number of contacts in the contact list.

items.description: Contact list ids. These can be retrieved using the [List campaign contact lists API.](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/campaign/GET/contact_center/outbound_campaign/contact_lists)

max_ring_time.description: Use with `max_ring_time_enabled`. A call is considered unanswered after the maximum ring time has elapsed. Maximum ring time must be between 15 and 120 seconds.

business_hour_source.description:
The Contact Center business hour source. Select `queue` to use the outbound queue's business hours, and `campaign` to set custom hours. Defaults to `queue`.
When this value is `queue`, the operating hours are not provided in the API response. [Use the Get Queue Operating Hours API.](/docs/contact-center/apis/#operation/getAQueueOperatingHours)

business_hour_id.description:
The Contact Center business hours ID. The campaign will only dial during these hours.
[Create business hours API.](/docs/contact-center/apis/#operation/businessHourCreate)

enable_closure_hour.description: Toggle closure hours on or off. Outbound calls are not started during closure hours.

closure_set_id.description:
The Contact Center closure hours ID.
[Create closure hours API.](/docs/contact-center/apis/#operation/closuresSetCreate)

contact_timezone_source.description:
Determines the source used to establish the contacts timezone for deciding appropriate calling hours (9 AM to 5 PM).

**Valid values**

`none` - Disables timezone-based calling restrictions; calls can be made at any time.

`timezone` - Uses the contact's explicit timezone attribute to determine calling eligibility.

`area_code` - Derives the timezone based on the area code of the contact's highest priority phone number according to the dial order.

assign_type.description:
Phone number type.
* 1 - Queue Caller ID
* 2 - Account Default Caller ID
* 3 - Customer Caller ID
* 4 - Automatic Caller ID

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `5008`
Campaign phone number not found. Please check that the phone number exists in Contact Center Preferences and that the ID is correct.
**Error Code:** `5009`
Campaign greeting asset not found. Please check that the asset exists in Contact Center Asset Library and that the ID is correct.
**Error Code:** `5010`
Campaign AMD asset not found. Please check that the asset exists in Contact Center Asset Library and that the ID is correct.
**Error Code:** `300`
Validation failed.
**Error Code:** `302`
Invalid enum value.
**Error Code:** `5011`
Campaign Business Hour not found. Please check that the Operating Hour exists in Contact Center Preferences and that the ID is correct.
**Error Code:** `5012`
Campaign Closure Hour Set not found. Please check that the Operating Hour exists in Contact Center Preferences and that the ID is correct.
**Error Code:** `5016`
The maximum number of contacts assigned to a campaign cannot exceed 100000.

post.description:
Create a new [disposition](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4470153057549-Managing-dispositions). Dispositions let agents assign an outcome or topic to each engagement. After creating dispositions, you can add them to queues. 

 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_disposition:write:admin`

sub_dispositions.description: For `single` dispositions, this field can be ignored. For `multi_level` dispositions, there must be at least one subdisposition. There can be up to 500, and each parent node can have up to 20 child nodes. Child nodes can only have up to 4 levels.

parent_index.description:
The index of the parent node that the current node belongs to. 
If it is `0`, it means that the current node belongs to the root node.
If the parent index does not exist, the node will be discarded.

* `in_app_video` - Only applies to video channel. 
* `kiosk_video` - Only applies to video channel. 
* `web_video` - Only applies to video channel. 
* `in_app_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel.  
* `web_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel. 
* `sms` - Only applies to messaging channel. 
* `facebook_messenger` - Only applies to messaging channel.
* `whatsapp` - Only applies to messaging channel.
* `email_address` - Only applies to email channel.

It provides `multiple channel_sources`.

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

timezone.description: The call's [timezone ID](/docs/api/references/abbreviations/#timezones). The default is UTC.

from.description: The start time and date in `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, return data from the past 24 hours.

to.description: **Required** only when the `from` parameter is specified. The end time and date in `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` format, the same format as the `from` parameter.

start_time.description: The date and time when the engagement started, in ISO 8601 format, either `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` or `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'`. `start_time` will be the time according to the timezone indicated by the user. If no timezone is provided, `start_time` will be in UTC.

end_time.description: The date and time when the engagement ended, in ISO 8601 format, either `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` or `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'`. `start_time` will be the time according to the timezone indicated by the user. If no timezone is provided, `start_time` will be in UTC.

channel_types.description:
The channel's type. 
* voice 
* SMS 
* chat 
* video 
* kiosk 
* in_app_chat 
* in_app_video

channel_source.description:
The channel's source. 
* `in_app_video` - Only applies to video channel. 
* `kiosk_video` - Only applies to video channel. 
* `web_video` - Only applies to video channel. 
* `in_app_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel.  
* `web_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel. 
* `sms` - Only applies to messaging channel.
* `facebook_messenger` - Only applies to messaging channel.
* `whatsapp` - Only applies to messaging channel.
* `email_address` - Only applies to email channel.

talk_duration.description: The engagement's talk duration, in seconds.

flow_duration.description: The engagement's flow duration, in seconds.

waiting_duration.description: The engagement's waiting duration, in seconds.

handling_duration.description: The handling duration, in seconds. This setting applies to all channels.

wrap_up_duration.description: The engagement's wrap-up duration, in seconds.

note.example: This is the content of the note.

last_modified_time.description: The date and time when this note was last modified, in ISO 8601 format, either `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` or `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'`. `last_modified_time` will be the time according to the timezone indicated by the user. If no timezone is provided, `last_modified_time` will be in UTC.

transcript_url.description:
The URL to download the messaging transcript, if the transcript text file exists. This field is only used for Messaging engagements. For voice and video engagement recordings, see `List engagement recordings` API. 
For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to download the transcript file using this URL. Example:
```curl --request GET 
  --url {transcript_url} 
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' 
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
```

transcript_url.description:
The URL to download the messaging transcript, if the transcript text file exists. This field is only used for messaging engagements. For voice and video engagement recordings, see the `List engagement recordings` API. 

For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to download the transcript file using this URL. 

**Example**:
```curl --request GET 
  --url {transcript_url} 
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' 
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
```

patch.description:

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_engagement:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:update:engagement:admin`

parameters.name: engagementId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the engagement to be updated.

requestBody.description:
Allows updating the status of an active engagement. The only accepted value is `end`. This operation will end the engagement and move it to closed status.

**Supported channels**
- Messaging (Headless Web Chat)
- Email
- Work Item

**Unsupported channels**
- Messaging (Web Chat, In App Chat, SMS, Facebook Messenger, Whatsapp, Instagram)
- Voice
- Video

engagement_status.description: The new status to set for the engagement. Currently, only `end` is supported to indicate the engagement has ended.

204.description: **HTTP 204 No Content**  The engagement was successfully updated. No content is returned in the response body.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `2907`
Invalid engagement_status. Only \"end\" is supported.

If the recording status change failed, it does not explicitly show in this API response.

If the recording status does not change within 5 seconds of an expected change, assume that the recording status did not successfully transition to the expected status. If used with the recording control API, the control API request can be re-attempted.

 Toll-Free  
 Virtual  
 Mobile

channel_source.description:

- `in_app_chat` - Only applies to the messaging channel.  
- `web_chat` - Only applies to the messaging channel.  
- `sms` - Only applies to **messaging** channel  
- `team_chat`  Only applies to **messaging** channel

- `facebook_messenger`  Only applies to **messaging** channel  
- `whatsapp`  Only applies to **messaging** channel  
- `email_address`  Only applies to **email** channel  
- `api` - Only applies to work_item channel.

*1 - user
*2 - access list
*3 - queue
*4 - team
*5 - rotation

voicemail_auto_assignment_during_active_.description: The person assigned the voicemail auto assignment is during an active work session.The value can only be `0` inactive or `1` active. This field is only effective when `voicemail_auto_assignment_type` is `2`, `3`, `4`, or `5`.

voicemail_auto_assignment_content_id.description: The voicemail auto assignment operation object's ID. Can be `userId`, `queueId` or `teamId`. This field is only effective when `voicemail_auto_assignment_type` is `1`, `3`, or `4`.

voicemail_auto_assignment_routine_profil.description: Routine profile ID used by voicemail auto assignment. This field only takes effect when `voicemail_auto_assignment_type` is `2`, `3`, `4,` or `5`, and the user has set a routine profile.

enable.description: Enable a reminder policy for unresolved voicemails.

download_url.description:
The URL to download the inbox message. For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to download the inbox message file using this URL. Example:
```curl --request GET 
  --url {download_url} 
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' 
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
```

playback_url.description:
The URL to playback the inbox message. For security purposes, you  **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to playback the inbox message file using this URL. Example:
```curl --request GET 
  --url {playback_url} 
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' 
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
```

transcript_url.description:
The URL to download the inbox message transcript. For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to download the recording transcript file using this URL. Example:
```curl --request GET 
  --url {transcript_url} 
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' 
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
```

message_duration.description: The inbox message's duration in seconds.

status.description:
The inbox message soft delete flag. 
* normal 
* deleted

queue_id.description: The queue ID of the inbox message routed by the queue.

queue_name.description: The queue name of the inbox message routed by the queue.

download_url.description:
The URL to download the inbox message. For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to download the inbox message file using this URL. Example:
```curl --request GET 
  --url {download_url} 
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' 
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
```

playback_url.description:
The URL to playback the inbox message. For security purposes, you  **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to playback the inbox message file using this URL. Example:
```curl --request GET 
  --url {playback_url} 
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' 
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
```

transcript_url.description:
The URL to download the inbox message transcript. For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to download the recording transcript file using this URL. Example:
```curl --request GET 
  --url {transcript_url} 
  --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' 
  --header 'content-type: application/json'
```

message_duration.description: The inbox message's duration in seconds.

200.description: A list of messages belonging to the specified email engagement.

messages.description: List of messages exchanged during the engagement.

content.description: The original full content of the email, including formatting or markup.

sent_time.description: The timestamp when the email was sent, in ISO 8601 format (UTC), to the millisecond.

to.description: The list of recipients for this email.

cc.description: The list of carbon copy (CC) recipients for this email. These recipients can see each other's addresses.

bcc.description: The list of blind carbon copy (BCC) recipients for this email. These recipients cannot see each other's addresses.

content_mime_type.description: The MIME type of the email content, indicating its format and character encoding.

message_type.description: The message type. `general` indicates a standard user message, while `system` indicates a message generated by the system, such as engagement events or status updates.

files.description: The list of files attached to this email.

file_type.description: The file's MIME type or format.

file_name.description: The name of the file, including its extension.

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

inline_files.description: The list of inline files embedded within the email content, such as images or logos displayed directly in the message body.

post.description:
Send an SMS message.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_sms:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:write:sms:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

contact_center_number.description: This must be an SMS capable phone number allocated to Zoom Contact Center within the customer account. Enter the number in E.164 format. Get the number via Zoom PAYG Global Number SKU after meeting the in-country compliance requirements.

consumer_numbers.description: The phone number of the person receiving the SMS. Consumer numbers should be in the E.164 format. Opt in - START - and opt out - STOP - keywords received from this number will be honored. This field may not be empty. Maximum length of the array is 20 items.

body.description: The content that needs to be sent as an SMS. Maximum length is 500 characters. Messages will be broken into smaller segments of 160 characters and concatenated at the time of delivery. Unicode characters and emojis are supported. You can send any text or URL. MMS is not supported. There is no support for handling inbound messages and delivery confirmations.

consumer_number.description: The consumer's phone number, in e164 format.

message_id.description: The message ID. Indicates the action of sending a message from this `contact_center_number` to this consumer number.

success.description: Indicates whether the SMS was sent successfully.

description.description: The error message returned when the SMS was not successfully sent.
description.example: The consumer number you have messaged has not opted in
enum: Invalid consumer number. The format of the consumer number used is incorrect. E.164 format is required
Zoom Contact Center numbers cannot be used as consumer numbers. Retry using a non Zoom Contact Center number
The consumer number you have messaged has not opted in
This consumer number has opted out of receiving SMS from this Zoom contact center number
This consumer number is a part of the block list defined by your Zoom Contact Center account administrator and cannot be messaged
International messaging is not supported on this account

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `1405`
`contact_center_number` has not enabled SMS feature.
**Error Code:** `1408`
`consumer_number` cannot be more than 20 digits.
**Error Code:** `1404`
`contact_center_number` not found.
**Error Code:** `1412`
`body` can't be empty.
**Error Code:** `1413`
SMS `body` is too long.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](/docs/api/rate-limits/).

from.description: The start time and date in ISO 8601 format, either `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` or `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'`. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, return data from the past 24 hours.

to.description: **Required** only when the `from` parameter is specified. The end time and date in ISO 8601 format, either `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` or `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'`, the same format as the `from` parameter.

call_legs.description: The direction of the engagement call leg. `inbound` | `outbound`.

sub_types.description: Specifies the detailed call leg type, such as a transfer or conference call.

start_time.description: The date and time when the engagement started in ISO 8601 format, either `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` or `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'`.

end_time.description: The date and time when the engagement ended in ISO 8601 format, either `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` or `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'`.

total_duration.description: The engagement's total duration, in seconds.

user_ip_address.description: IP address of the agent's device.

user_registered_sip_zone.description: The SIP zone where the agent registered.

recorded.description: Flag to determine whether to recorded.

inbox.description: Flag to determine whether a message is in the box.

rates.description: The price for each sent message.

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:read:list_closure_hours:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: account_default
parameters.description: Default business hours or closures for the newly-created queue.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

timezone.description: The closure set's timezone ID.

account_default.description: Default closure for the newly-created queue.

queues_count.description: The number of queues using the closure set.

flows_count.description: The number of flows using the closure set.

closure_hour_type.description:
The closure's time type. 
* `1` — All day. 
* `2` — Customized time.

start_time.description: The closure's start time and date in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z', or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'.

end_time.description: The closure's end time and date in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z', or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'.

recurring_frequency.description:
The frequency of a closure's recurrence. 
* `0` — Never. 
* `1` — Annually. 
* `2` — Monthly. 
* `3` — Weekly.

recurring_frequency_type.description:
The closure time's type of recurrence. This applies to `Annually`, `Monthly` and `Weekly` repeat frequency. It returns only for the not `Never` recurrence type. 
* `1` — Specific. 
* `2` — Customized.

recurring_month.description:
The recurrence month. It returns only for the `Annually` recurrence type. 
* `1` — January 
* `2` — February 
* `3` — March 
* `4` — April 
* `5` — May 
* `6` — June 
* `7` — July 
* `8` — August 
* `9` — September 
* `10` — October 
* `11` — November 
* `12` — December

recurring_week_interval.description: The number of weekly recurrences. It returns only for the `Customized` recurrence time types. When it is `Annually/Customized` or `Monthly/Customized` type, the minimum value is `1` and the maximum value is `5`. When it is `Weekly/Customized` type, the minimum value is `1` and the maximum value is `12`.

recurring_days_of_week.description:
The week days of a recurrence. It returns only for the `Weekly/Customized`, the `Weekly/Specific`, the `Annually/Customized` and the `Monthly/Customized` recurrence time types. When the type is "`Weekly/Customized`", there may be multiple values. 
* `1` — Monday 
* `2` — Tuesday 
* `3` — Wednesday 
* `4` — Thursday 
* `5` — Friday 
* `6` — Saturday 
* `7` — Sunday

end_time.description: The closure's end time and date in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z', or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'.

recurring_frequency.description:
The frequency of a closure's recurrence. 
* `0` — Never. 
* `1` — Annually. 
* `2` — Monthly. 
* `3` — Weekly.

recurring_frequency_type.description:
The closure time's type of recurrence. Applies to `Annually`, `Monthly`, and `Weekly` repeat frequency. Returns only for the not `Never` recurrence type. 
* `1` — Specific. 
* `2` — Customized.

recurring_month.description:
The recurrence month. Required only for the `Annually` recurrence type. 
* `1` — January 
* `2` — February 
* `3` — March 
* `4` — April 
* `5` — May 
* `6` — June 
* `7` — July 
* `8` — August 
* `9` — September 
* `10` — October 
* `11` — November 
* `12` — December

recurring_week_interval.description: The number of weekly recurrences. Required only for the `Customized` recurrence time types. When the type is `Annually/Customized` or `Monthly/Customized`, the minimum value is `1` and the maximum value is `5`. When the type is `Weekly/Customized`, the minimum value is `1` and the maximum value is `12`.

recurring_days_of_week.description:
The week days of a recurrence. Required only for the `Weekly/Customized`, `Weekly/Specific`, `Annually/Customized`, and `Monthly/Customized` recurrence time types. When the type is "`Weekly/Customized`", there may be multiple values. 
* `1` — Monday 
* `2` — Tuesday 
* `3` — Wednesday 
* `4` — Thursday 
* `5` — Friday 
* `6` — Saturday 
* `7` — Sunday

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `3602`
Timezone does not exist.
**Error Code:** `3702`
The closure name has already been duplicated: $closure_name.
**Error Code:** `3703`
The end time should be greater than the start time.
**Error Code:** `3704`
The `recurring_frequency_type` should not be empty when the `recurring_frequency` is anything other than `Never`.
**Error Code:** `3705`
The `start_time` and `end_time` must be in the same year when the `recurring_frequency` is `Annually`.
**Error Code:** `3706`
The `start_time` and `end_time` must be in the same month when the `recurring_frequency` is `Monthly`.
**Error Code:** `3707`
The `start_time` and `end_time` must be in the same week when the `recurring_frequency` is `Weekly`.
**Error Code:** `3708`
The `recurring_week_interval` should not be empty when the `recurring_frequency_type` type is `Customized`.
**Error Code:** `3709`
The `recurring_days_of_week` should not be empty when the `recurring_frequency_type` type is `Customized`.
**Error Code:** `3710`
The `recurring_month` should not be empty when the type is `Annually/Customized`.
**Error Code:** `3711`
The `recurring_week_interval` should be between `1` and `5` when the `recurring_frequency` type is `Annually` or `Monthly`.
**Error Code:** `3712`
The `start_time` and `end_time` must match the `timezone`: $start_time/$end_time.
**Error Code:** `3603`
The name already exists.
**Error Code:** `3714`
The `recurring_days_of_week` should be between `1` and `7`.
**Error Code:** `300`
Validation failed.

parameters.name: queueId
parameters.description: Currently supports two different IDs, the task queue's ID and Contact Center queue's ID. The task queue's ID will be completely deprecated in the future. Change to the Contact Center queue ID as soon as possible.

max_wait_time.description: The task queue's maximum wait time, in seconds.

wrap_up_time.description: The task queue's wrap up time, in seconds.

max_engagement_in_queue.description: The task queue's maximum engagement in queue value.

enable.description: Whether the **Enable short abandon** setting is enabled.

threshold.description: The task queue's short abandon threshold, in seconds.

short_abandon.description: Information about the task queue's [**Short Abandon**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4469989300493-Changing-queue-settings#:~:text=for%20this%20queue.-,Short%20Abandon,-(only%20available%20if) settings. This setting is only available if the queue's channel type is a Zoom Room, voice, or video.

distribution_duration_in_seconds.description: The notify duration for each queue user, in seconds.

connecting_media_id.description:
**Deprecated** See `queue_waiting_experience` object.

Media ID to use while users are being connected.

Channel type: voice.

connecting_media_filename.description:
**Deprecated** See `queue_waiting_experience` object.

File name of the media in use while consumers are being connected.
Channel type: voice.

transferring_media_id.description:
**Deprecated** See `queue_waiting_experience` object.

Media ID to use while users are being transferred.
Channel type: voice.

transferring_media_filename.description:
**Deprecated** See `queue_waiting_experience` object.

File name of the media to use while users are being transferred.
Channel type: voice.

holding_media_id.description:
**Deprecated** See `queue_waiting_experience` object.

Media ID to use while users are on hold.
Channel type: voice.

holding_media_filename.description:
**Deprecated** See `queue_waiting_experience` object.

File name of the media to use while users are on hold.
Channel type: voice.

waiting_room_name.description:
Name of the user's waiting room.
Channel type - video.

waiting_room_id.description:
ID of the waiting room for users.
Channel type - video.

message_accept.description:
Option to accept a message manually or automatically.
Channel types - chat, SMS.

wrap_up_expiration.description:
Auto-close engagements at the end of wrap-up duration.
Channel type - voice, video.

overflow_type.description:
Type of overflow.

0 - Reply goodbye message, then disconnect. 1 - Route to queue. 2 - Leave email. 3 - Route to flow.

overflow_to_goodbye_message_asset_id.description: Reply goodbye message. Use asset instead of system default audio.

overflow_to_queue_id.description: The queue ID to receive the overflow.

 Only one of these overflow fields can be updated each time, either `overflow_to_goodbye_message`, `overflow_to_cc_queue_id`, `overflow_to_flow_id`, or `overflow_to_inbox_id`. Updating an overflow field will clear out the other overflow fields.

overflow_to_flow_id.description: The flow ID to receive the overflow.

overflow_to_inbox_id.description: The voicemail inbox ID to receive the overflow.

auto_close_message_enabled.description:
Send an auto-closed message for web chats.

auto_close_alert_message.description: An alert message to web-chat users before auto-closing.

auto_close_alert_message_enabled.description:
Send an alert message before auto-closing web chats.
Channel type - chat.

auto_close_alert_message_time.description: How long, in minutes, before a warning is sent to the user.

recording_storage_location.description:

- us - United States
- au - Australia
- br - Brazil
- ca - Canada
- de - Germany
- jp - Japan
- sg - Singapore

Supported channel types - voice, video.

service_level_exclude_long_abandoned_cal.description:

enable_agent_whisper_announcement.description: Whether to enable playing an announcement to the agent.

enable_agent_greeting.description: Whether to enable playing a default agent greeting.

greeting_filename.description: The agent greeting audio's file name.

whisper_filename.description: The agent whisper announcement audio's file name.

config.description: Configurations of launching URL and methods to launch.

queue_disposition_type.description:
Type of inbound disposition.
0 - Mandatory, 1 - Optional.

inbound_dispositions.description: Queue configured inbound dispositions and disposition sets.

queue_disposition_type.description:
Type of outbound disposition.
0 - Mandatory, 1 - Optional.

outbound_dispositions.description: Queue configured outbound dispositions and disposition sets.

wrap_up_after_transfer.description: Whether to enable wrap up transfer.

queue_caller_ids.description:
The queue's outbound caller ID number list. A caller ID number is what your customers will see on their phone when agents and supervisors reach out to them. Assign numbers that users can update from the default caller ID when they call consumers.

Only for voice queues. When a voice queue is configured with caller ID(s), the list will populate with phone numbers.

items.description: Caller ID number, in E.164 format.

enable_launch_url.description: Whether to enable outbound launch URL section.

outbound_call_duration_lower_threshold.description: Minimum talking duration for brief outbound engagements, in seconds.

outbound_call_duration_upper_threshold.description: Maximum talking duration for brief outbound engagements, inseconds.

outbound_labels.description:
Set up the talking duration for brief outbound engagements, labeled in reports as **short calls**, which also sets the duration for long calls and hang-up calls.

Short calls - Select minimum and maximum talking duration of short calls using the `outbound_call_duration_lower_threshold` and `outbound_call_duration_upper_threshold` values.
Long calls - Over 2 minutes.
Hang-up calls - Under 10 seconds.

outbound_disposition_required.description: Whether an outbound disposition is required.

outbound_wrap_up_time.description: Outbound wrap up time, in seconds.

outbound_wrap_up_expiration.description: Auto-close outbound engagements at the end of wrap-up duration.

outbound_wrap_up_after_transfer.description: Whether to enable wrap up after outbound transfer.

consumer_inquiry_option.description: The unique keyword that consumers can choose to identify this queue.

voice_id.description: The TTS service's voice ID to generate audio for the greeting message.

message_text.example: You will be connected to the next available agent in a short moment.

scheduled_callback_settings.description: Queue configurations for callback and greeting message.

patch.description:
Update a queue's settings.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_queue:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:update:queue:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: queueId
parameters.description: Currently supports two different IDs, the old task queue's ID and the new Contact Center queue's ID. Since the task queue ID will be deprecated in the future, change to the Contact Center queue's ID as soon as possible.

max_wait_time.description: The task queue's maximum wait time, in seconds.

wrap_up_time.description: The task queue's wrap up time, in seconds.

max_engagement_in_queue.description: The task queue's maximum engagement in queue. Value must be between 0 and 3000.

enable.description: Whether to enable the **Short Abandon** setting.

threshold.description: The task queue's **Short Abandon** threshold, in seconds.

short_abandon.description: Information about the task queue's [**Short Abandon**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/4469989300493-Changing-queue-settings#:~:text=for%20this%20queue.-,Short%20Abandon,-(only%20available%20if) settings. This setting is only available if the queue's channel type is a Zoom Room, voice, or video.

distribution_type.description:
Distribute incoming engagements.
**Allowed** 
* 0 - Longest Idle. This value is only supported if the channel types contain voice or video.
* 1 - Sequential. This value is only supported if the channel types contain voice or video.
* 2 - Rotating. This value is only supported if the channel types contain voice or video.
* 3 - Simultaneous. This value is only supported if the channel types contain voice or video.
* 4 - Most Available. This value is only supported if the channel types contain chat or sms.
* 5 - Manual. This value is only supported if the channel types contain video.
* 6 - Longest idle while ready. This value is only supported if the channel types contain voice or video.
* 7 - Longest idle for this queue. This value is only supported if the channel types contain voice or video.

distribution_duration_in_seconds.description: The notify duration for each queue user, in seconds. The default on new queues is 30 seconds.

connecting_media_id.description:
Media ID to use while users are being connected.
Channel - `voice`
connecting_media_id.default: Passing an empty string will set this option to the default media.

transferring_media_id.description:
Media ID to use while users are being transferred.
Channel - `voice`
transferring_media_id.default: Passing an empty string will set this option to the default media.

holding_media_id.description:
Media ID to use while users are on hold.
Channel - `voice`
holding_media_id.default: Passing an empty string will set this option to the default media.

waiting_room_id.description:
The users' waiting room ID.
Channel - `video`

message_accept.description:
Option to accept a message manually or automatically.
Channels - `messaging: web_chat`, `messaging: sms`

wrap_up_expiration.description:
Auto-close engagements at the end of wrap-up duration.
Channels - `voice`, `video`

wrap_up_after_transfer.description: Add wrap-up time after transferring an engagament.

overflow_to_goodbye_message.description:
Reply goodbye message, then disconnect.

 Only one of these overflow fields can be updated each time, `overflow_to_goodbye_message`, `overflow_to_queue_id`, `overflow_to_flow_id`, or `overflow_to_inbox_id`. Updating an overflow field will clear out the other overflow fields.

overflow_to_queue_id.description:
The queue ID to receive the overflow.

 Only one of these overflow fields can be updated each time, `overflow_to_goodbye_message`, `overflow_to_queue_id`, `overflow_to_flow_id`, or `overflow_to_inbox_id`. Updating an overflow field will clear out the other overflow fields.

overflow_to_cc_queue_id.description:
The Contact Center queue ID to receive the overflow.

 Only one of these overflow fields can be updated each time, `overflow_to_goodbye_message`, `overflow_to_cc_queue_id`, `overflow_to_flow_id`, or `overflow_to_inbox_id`. Updating an overflow field will clear out the other overflow fields.

overflow_to_flow_id.description:
The flow ID to receive the overflow.
Get the flow ID from [**List Flow API**](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/inboxes/delete/contact_center/inboxes/{inboxId}/messages).

Only one of these overflow fields can be updated each time, `overflow_to_goodbye_message`, `overflow_to_queue_id`, `overflow_to_flow_id`, or `overflow_to_inbox_id`. Updating an overflow field will clear out the other overflow fields.

overflow_to_inbox_id.description:
The voicemail inbox ID to receive the overflow.
Get thed inbox ID from [**List Inboxes API**](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/inboxes/get/contact_center/inboxes).

 Only one of these overflow fields can be updated each time, `overflow_to_goodbye_message`, `overflow_to_queue_id`, `overflow_to_flow_id`, or `overflow_to_inbox_id`. Updating an overflow field will clear out the other overflow fields.

overflow_to_goodbye_message_asset_id.description:
Reply goodbye message choose from an asset.
Asset ID refer to Asset Library OpenAPI.
* [**Create Asset API**](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/asset-library/post/contact_center/asset_library/assets)
* [**List Asset API**](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/asset-library/get/contact_center/asset_library/assets)

auto_close_message.example: This chat has been auto-closed due to inactivity.

auto_close_message_enabled.description:
Send an auto-closed message for web chats.
Channel: `messaging: web_chat`

auto_close_timeout.description: How long, in minutes, before the chat is auto-closed.

Channel: `messaging: web_chat`

auto_close_alert_message_time.description: How long, in minutes, before a warning is sent to the user.

Determine where to store the recording.
- us - United States
- au - Australia
- br - Brazil

- de - Germany
- jp - Japan
- sg - Singapore

Supported channel types: voice, video.

service_level_threshold_in_seconds.description: First message speed by agents for all engagements.

service_level_exclude_short_abandoned_ca.description:
Choose to include short abandoned calls in service level metrics.
Channels: `voice`, `video`

service_level_exclude_long_abandoned_cal.description:
Choose to include long abandoned calls in service level metrics.
Channels: `voice`, `video`

service_level_exclude_abandoned_quit_eng.description:
Choose to include quit engagements in service level metrics.
Channels: `messaging: web_chat`, `messaging: in_app_chat`, `messaging: sms`

service_level_exclude_overflow_engagemen.description:
Choose to exclude overflow engagements.
Channel: `email`

service_level_target_in_percentage.description: The service-level target as the benchmark to refer to in reports.

agent_routing_profile_id.description: The queue's agent routing profile ID. If this is empty, the agent routing profile will be removed.

allow_agent_select_skill_for_transfer.description: Agent routing to allow agent to specify skills during the transfer. This requires the routing profile enable 'Route engagement to last engaged agent first'.

maximum_look_back_period.description:
The timeframe for searching previous engagements with the consumer to determine the last agent, in minutes.
This is only supported if the channel types contain voice or video.

last_engaged_agent_data_from_queue_ids.description:
Last engaged agent data from the queue.
Select queues that will be evaluated to determine the last engaged agent, based on maximum look-back period.
Default to All queues if no select queue id.
This is only supported if the channel types contain voice or video.
To get the queue ID, use [**List Queue API**](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/queues/get/contact_center/queues).

agent_routing_settings.description: A routing profile to route the engagement to queue users, based on who has the corresponding skills.

consumer_routing_profile_id.description: The queue's consumer routing profile ID.

enable_agent_alert_tone.description:
Whether to play an alert tone to the agent.
Can only enable 'enable_agent_alert_tone' or 'enable_agent_whisper_announcement'. This setting is for engagement acceptance type set as `auto`.

enable_agent_whisper_announcement.description:
Whether to play an announcement to the agent.
Can only enable 'enable_agent_alert_tone' or 'enable_agent_whisper_announcement'. This setting is for engagement acceptance type set as `auto`.

agent_whisper_announcement_asset_id.description:
Play a whisper announcement, chosen from the [asset library](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/routing-profiles/get/contact_center/consumer_routing_profiles), to the agent.
Required when 'enable_agent_whisper_announcement' is `true`.

enable_agent_greeting.description: Whether to enable playing a default agent greeting. This setting is for engagements whose acceptance type is set as `auto`.

agent_greeting_asset_id.description: Play a greeting message chosen from the asset library. To find the asset ID, use the [**List Asset API**](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/asset-library/get/contact_center/asset_library/assets). Required when 'enable_agent_greeting' is `true`.

config.description: Configurations of launching URL and methods to launch.

launch_trigger.description: Methods to trigger the launch URL.

launch_url.description: URL to be launched. Enter a URL beginning with `https://`.

enable_launch_url.description: Whether to enable inbound launch URL section.

inbound_launch_url_info.description:
Inbound launch URL configurations.
The URL link launches for each engagement according to the selected trigger.

notes_asset_id.description:
Provide a template from the asset library for agents to follow when writing notes, choose from asset.
Refer Asset API:
[Create Asset API](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/asset-library/post/contact_center/asset_library/assets)
[Get Asset API](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/asset-library/get/contact_center/asset_library/assets)

disposition_required.description:
Whether a queue disposition is required.
* `true` - manadatory
*`false` - optional

default_disposition_id.description: When a queue disposition is required. Must assign a default disposition.

queue_caller_ids.description:
What customers see on their phone when agents and supervisors reach out to them. Assign numbers that users can update from the default caller ID when they call consumers.
Get a `caller_id` from [Get A Queue API](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/queues/get/contact_center/queues/{queueId}).

items.description:
What customers see on their phone when agents and supervisors reach out to them. Assign numbers that users can update from the default caller ID when they call consumers.
Get a `caller_id` from [Get A Queue API](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/queues/get/contact_center/queues/{queueId}).

config.description: Configurations for launching a URL and methods to launch.

url.description: URL to be launched. Enter a URL beginning with `https://`.

enable_launch_url.description: Whether to enable the outbound launch URL section.

outbound_call_duration_lower_threshold.description: Minimum talking duration for brief outbound engagements, in seconds.

outbound_call_duration_upper_threshold.description: Maximum talking duration for brief outbound engagements, in seconds.

outbound_labels.description: The talking duration for brief outbound engagements, labeled in reports as short calls. This also sets the duration for long calls and hang-up calls.

outbound_transferring_media_id.description:
Media, chosen from the asset library, to use while users are being transferred.
Channel: `voice`.

To find the asset ID, use the [**List Asset API**](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/asset-library/get/contact_center/asset_library/assets).
outbound_transferring_media_id.default: Passing an empty string will set this option to the default media.

outbound_holding_media_id.description:
Media ID, chosen from the asset library, to use while users are on hold.
Channel: `voice`.

To find the asset ID, use the [**List Asset API**](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/asset-library/get/contact_center/asset_library/assets).
outbound_holding_media_id.default: Passing an empty string will set this option to the default media.

outbound_notes_asset_id.description:
Provide a template, chosen from the asset library, for agents to follow when writing notes.
Channel: `voice`, `video`, or `messaging`.

To find the asset ID, use the [**List Asset API**](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/asset-library/get/contact_center/asset_library/assets).

outbound_disposition_required.description:
Whether a queue disposition is required.
* `true` - manadatory
* `false` - optional

outbound_default_disposition_id.description: When a queue disposition is required. Must assign a default disposition.

outbound_wrap_up_time.description: The task queue's wrap up time, in seconds.

outbound_wrap_up_expiration.description: Auto-close engagements at the end of wrap-up duration. Channel types - `voice`, `video`.

outbound_wrap_up_after_transfer.description: Agents can wrap up when transferring internally or when a supervisor takes over from them. Channel types - `voice`, `video`.

enable_scheduled_callback.description:
Whether to enable scheduled callbacks.
When 'enable_scheduled_callback' is `false`, the other settings under 'scheduled_callback_settings' will not take effect.

consumer_inquiry_option.description: The unique keyword that consumers can choose to identify this queue. This keyword displays to consumers as an inquiry option when they schedule callbacks.

custom_media_asset_id.description: The audio asset ID for a greeting message's custom media.

language_code.description: The default message's language (IETF language tag).

voice_id.description: The TTS service's voice ID to generate audio for the greeting message.

message_text.example: You will be connected to the next available agent in a short moment.

greeting_message.description: Message to play when consumers receive the callback. Choose customized media from `asset_library` and set 'custom_media_asset_id'. Alternately, set the 'massage_text', 'lang_code', and 'voice_id' together, then will play the message according to language and voice.

scheduled_callback_settings.description: Queue configurations for the scheduled callback.
