post.summary: Assign a queue menu based interrupt
post.description:
Create a menu of options to offer to consumers during the queue waiting experience. Currently, the only support for queue channel type is voice.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_queue:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:update:queue:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: queueId
parameters.description: Queue identifier.

menu_language_code.description: The menu language and voice that is applied to default messages for menu and callback prompts.

voice_id.description: The voice used to play the menu prompts.

accept_timeout.description: Time to accept menu, at 5 second intervals. `0` means accept menu at any time.

play_interval.description:
Time, in seconds, to offer menu sets when consumers will be offered the menu, as long as they're still waiting. When this time is less than their estimated wait time, they will be asked right away.
Maximum time is less than the maximum wait duration.

loop_play.description: Enable loop play based on loop interval time.

loop_interval.description: Loop play interval, in seconds. Required when `loop_play` is `true`.

menu_options.description:
A list of menu options for keypresses and detail menu action.
Each keypress can only be related to one action.

keypress.description: The keypress provided in the menu.

menu_action.description: The keypress action for selecting the menu.

play_message.description: The text message to play for the keypress.
play_message.example:
If you would like to leave a voicemail, press {{keyPress}}.
Do not edit or remove symbols and text in {{}}, this will play and tell consumer the keypress for the menu action.

route_to_flow_id.description:
Select a voice flow to route when the chosen menu action is `route_flow`. 
Get the voice flow's ID from the [**List flows API**](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/flows/get/contact_center/flows).

voice_mail_inbox_id.description:
Select a voice mail inbox when the chosen menu action is `leave_voicemail`.
Get the voicemail inbox's ID from the [**List Inboxes API**](/docs/api/contact-center/#tag/inboxes/get/contact_center/inboxes).

callback_confirm_keypress.description: Callers use this key to confirm in response to message for a request callback.

accept_callback_timeout.description: Time to accepet callback menu, in seconds. Configured at 5 second intervals.

enable_offer_phone_number.description: Allow callers to provide a different callback number.

offer_number_message.description: The message to play to consumer ask to offer phone number for call back. Do not edit or remove symbols and text in {{}}. {{keyPress}} plays the keypress configured in 'callback_confirm_keypress' to the consumer.
offer_number_message.example: We'll call you back using the phone number {{current phone number}}. If you want to use a different number, enter it now and then press {{keyPress}}. Otherwise, please stay on the line or press {{keyPress}} now.
offer_number_message.default: We'll call you back using the phone number {{current phone number}}. If you want to use a different number, enter it now and then press {{keyPress}}. Otherwise, please stay on the line or press {{keyPress}} now.

callback_confirm_messsage.description: Message to the returning caller with callback set up. Do not edit or remove symbols and text in {{}}. {{keyPress}} plays the keypress configured in 'callback_confirm_keypress' to the consumer.
callback_confirm_messsage.example: Your request for callback is confirmed. We will use the phone number {{current phone number}} and extension {{extension number}} to call you back when it's your turn in the queue
callback_confirm_messsage.default: Your request for callback is confirmed. We will use the phone number {{current phone number}} and extension {{extension number}} to call you back when it's your turn in the queue

enable_offer_extension_number.description: Lets callers to add an extension to their callback phone number so that callers who don't have a direct line can still be reached directly.

offer_extension_number_message.description: Message asking the caller to give a phone number extension. Do not edit or remove symbols and text in {{}}. The {{keyPress}} plays the keypress configured in 'callback_confirm_keypress' to the consumer.
offer_extension_number_message.example: We'll call you back using the phone number {{current phone number}}. If you want to add an extension, enter it now and then press {{keyPress}}. Otherwise, please stay on the line or press {{keyPress}} now.
offer_extension_number_message.default: We'll call you back using the phone number {{current phone number}}. If you want to add an extension, enter it now and then press {{keyPress}}. Otherwise, please stay on the line or press {{keyPress}} now.

confirm_extension_number_message.description: Message asking the caller to confirm the phone number extension. Do not edit or remove symbols and text in {{}}. The {{keyPress}} plays the keypress configured in 'callback_confirm_keypress' to the comsumer.
confirm_extension_number_message.example: You entered the extension {{extension number}}. If this is correct, press {{keyPress}} to confirm. Otherwise, enter your extension number and then press {{keyPress}}.
confirm_extension_number_message.default: You entered the extension {{extension number}}. If this is correct, press {{keyPress}} to confirm. Otherwise, enter your extension number and then press {{keyPress}}.

outbound_dial_option.description: Choose the outbound method for how callers are connected when they receive a callback.

outbound_dial_greeting_message.description: greeting message to callers before they are connected to an agent.
outbound_dial_greeting_message.example: Thanks for waiting in the queue. You will be connected to the next available agent shortly.
outbound_dial_greeting_message.default: Thanks for waiting in the queue. You will be connected to the next available agent shortly.

callback_timeout.description: Set the limit for how long callbacks will remain as tasks in the queue, in seconds.

enable_callback_cancel_message.description: Send a message to consumers if callbacks are canceled.

callback_cancel_message.example: Your callback has been canceled due to high call volumes. Please try calling again.
callback_cancel_message.default: Your callback has been canceled due to high call volumes. Please try calling again.

callback_returning_message.description: Message to returning caller with callback setup. Do not edit or remove symbols and text in {{}}.The {{keyPress}} plays the keypress configured in 'callback_confirm_keypress' to the comsumer.
callback_returning_message.example: Hello again. You have a callback set up. Press {{keyPress}} to cancel your callback and wait on the line, or hang up to keep your callback request and end this call.
callback_returning_message.default: Hello again. You have a callback set up. Press {{keyPress}} to cancel your callback and wait on the line, or hang up to keep your callback request and end this call.

enable_callback_offer_time.description: Limit the times when callbacks will be offered to consumers.

callback_offer_timezone_id.description: Set the [timezone](/docs/api/references/abbreviations/#timezones) when callbacks will be offered and returned to consumers. Required when `enable_callback_offer_time` is `true`.

callback_offer_time.description: Set the day during which callbacks will be offered and returned to consumers. Required when `enable_callback_offer_time` is `true`.

callback_offer_day.description: Set the day when callbacks will be offered to consumers.

callback_offer_start_time.description: Start time on the day when callbacks will be offered to consumers, between `00:00` and `23:59`.

callback_offer_end_time.description: End time on the day when callbacks will be offered to consumers, between `00:00` and `23:59`.

enable_callback_return_time.description: Limit the times when callbacks will be returned to consumers.

callback_return_timezone_id.description: Set the [timezone ID](/docs/api/references/abbreviations/#timezones) to limit the times when callbacks will be returned to consumers. Required when `enable_callback_return_time` is `true`.

callback_return_day.description: The day when callbacks will be returned to consumers. Required when `enable_callback_return_time` is `true`.
The day when callbacks will be returned to consumers.

callback_return_start_time.description: Set the start time range when callbacks will be returned to consumers, between `00:00` to `23:59`.

callback_return_end_time.description: Set the end time range when callbacks will be returned to consumers, between `00:00` to `23:59`.

callback_settings.description: Set call back settings for when the menu action is `request_callback`.

delete.summary: Delete a queue's interrupt menu configuration
delete.description:
Deletes the interrupt menu configuration for a specific queue. This removes all menu-based interrupt settings including menu options, callback settings, voice prompts, and timing configurations.

This operation only works for voice queues. Other channel types will return an error.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_queue:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:delete:queue:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.description: Contact Center queue identifier.

 Interrupt menu deleted successfully. No content is returned.

get.description:
Get information about a queue's operating hours. 

 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_queue:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:read:queue_operating_hours:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: queueId
parameters.description:
The task queue's ID. Currently supports two different IDs, the task queue's ID and Contact Center queue's ID. 

**NOTE** The task queue's ID will be completely **deprecated** in the future. Change to the Contact Center queue ID as soon as possible.

account_default_business_hour.description: Whether the queue's business hour is the account default business hour.

account_default_closure_set.description: Whether the queue's closure set is the account default.

operating_hours_overflow_enabled.description: Specify consumer handling when the queue is unavailable.

overflow_to_default_goodbye_message.description: Reply system default goodbye message, then disconnect.

overflow_to_goodbye_message_asset_id.description: Reply goodbye message choose from an asset

overflow_to_goodbye_message_asset_name.description: Reply goodbye message choose from an asset name

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Upper time boundary for booking spots. If `min_time` and `max_time` are not provided a 7 day time range starting from the current day will be returned.

start_time.description: The booking slot's start time.

availability_status.description: Whether the time slot is available to book.

get.description:
Return a list of all of an engagement's recordings. 

**Note:** Use recording-related APIs to manipulate data whose recording was created after July 18, 2022. 

 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_recording:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:read:list_recordings:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: engagementId
parameters.description: The engagement event's unique ID.

parameters.name: channel_type
parameters.description:
The recording's channel type. 
* `voice` - Voice recording. 
* `video` - Video recording.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description:
The recording's channel type. 
* `voice` - Voice recording 
* `video` - Video recording

 If channel is used as an input parameter, the deprecated parameter `channnel_type` will not be processed.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start time and date in ISO 8601 format, either yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If unspecified, this parameter returns data from the past 30 days.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: **Required** only when the `from` parameter is specified. The end time and date in ISO 8601 format, either yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD', the same format as the `from` parameter.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

from.description: The start time and date in ISO 8601 format, either yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If unspecified, this parameter returns data from the past 30 days.

to.description: **Required** only when the `from` parameter is specified. The end time and date in ISO 8601 format, either yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD', the same format as the `from` parameter.

download_url.description:
The URL to download the recording. For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the Authorization header to download the recording file using this URL. Example:
 ```
curl --request GET \ 
 --url {download_url} \ 
 --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' \ 
 --header 'content-type: application/json'
```
Note: The URL may be a redirect. In that case, use `curl --location` to follow redirects or use another tool, like Postman.

transcript_url.description:
The URL to download the recording transcript. For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to download the recording transcript file using this URL. Example:
 ```
curl --request GET \ 
 --url {transcript_url} \ 
 --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' \ 
 --header 'content-type: application/json'
```
Note: The URL may be a redirect. In that case, use `curl --location` to follow redirects or use another tool, like Postman.

playback_url.description:
The URL to play the recording. For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to play the recording file using this URL. Example:
```
curl --request GET \ 
 --url {playback_url} \ 
 --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' \ 
 --header 'content-type: application/json'
```
Note: The URL may be a redirect. In that case, use `curl --location` to follow redirects or use another tool, like Postman.

recording_start_time.description: The date and time when the recording's start time in ISO 8601 format, either yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'.

recording_end_time.description: The date and time when the recording's end time in ISO 8601 format, either yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'TZD'.

recording_type.description:
The recording's type. 
* `on_demand` - Manually trigger recording. 
* `automatic` - Automatically trigger recording.

channel_type.description:
The recording's channel type. 
* `voice` - Voice recording. 
* `video` - Video recording.

channel.description:
The recording's channel type. 
* `voice` - Voice recording. 
* `video` - Video recording.

direction.description:
The recording's call direction. 
* `inbound` - Call in. 
* `outbound` - Call out.

owner_id.description: The recording's owner ID, either the queue ID or user ID.

owner_name.description: The recording's owner name, either the queue name or user name.

owner_type.description:
The recording's owner type. 
* `user` - This recording belongs to an userl 
* `queue` - This recording belongs to a queue.

consumer_name.description:
The customer's name.
* `Note` - This field will be abolished, and the `consumer_name` in `consumers` will be used uniformly.

consumer_number.description:
The customer's phone number.
* `Note` - This field will be abolished, and the `consumer_number` in `consumers` will be used uniformly.

download_url.description:
The URL to download the recording. For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the Authorization header to download the recording file using this URL. Example:
 ```
curl --request GET \ 
 --url {download_url} \ 
 --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' \ 
 --header 'content-type: application/json'
```
Note: The URL may be a redirect. In that case, use `curl --location` to follow redirects or use another tool, like Postman.

transcript_url.description:
The URL to download the recording transcript. For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to download the recording transcript file using this URL. Example:
 ```
curl --request GET \ 
 --url {transcript_url} \ 
 --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' \ 
 --header 'content-type: application/json'
```
Note: The URL may be a redirect. In that case, use `curl --location` to follow redirects or use another tool, like Postman.

playback_url.description:
The URL to play the recording. For security purposes, you **must** provide an OAuth access token in the authorization header to play the recording file using this URL. Example:
```
curl --request GET \ 
 --url {playback_url} \ 
 --header 'authorization: Bearer {access_token}' \ 
 --header 'content-type: application/json'
```
Note: The URL may be a redirect. In that case, use `curl --location` to follow redirects or use another tool, like Postman.

handled_count.description: The number of inbound - including callback - and outbound engagements handled by the queue.

handle_duration.description: The amount of time agents spent handling engagements, in milliseconds.

direct_transfer_count.description: The number of direct transfers initiated.

warm_transfer_initiated_count.description: The number of voice or video engagements an agent answered and then warm transferred with another participant with or without fully transferring the engagement.

warm_transfer_completed_count.description: The number of voice or video engagements an agent answered and then warm transferred with another participant and then fully transferred the engagements.

transfer_initiated_count.description: The number of transfers an agent initiated, including warm and direct transfers for voice and video channels, and all transfers for messaging and email channels with no distinction between warm and direct.

transfer_completed_count.description: The number of transfers an agent completed, including warm and direct transfers for voice and video channels, and all transfers for messaging and email channels with no distinction between warm and direct.

warm_conference_count.description: The number of warm conferences initiated.

agent_offered_count.description: The total number of engagements offered to an agent.

agent_refused_count.description: A number of times an agent missed or declined an engagement.

agent_missed_count.description: The total number of agent refused engagements the agent missed.

ring_disconnect_count.description: The count of all engagements that have been routed to a rung an agent, but the connection to this specific agent is not completed.

agent_declined_count.description: The total number of agent refused engagements that the agent declined.

agent_message_sent_count.description: A count of all messages sent by an agent for a unique engagement ID.

hold_count.description: The number of times that a consumer was placed on hold.

conversation_duration.description: The amount of time an agent spent in conversation with an engagement and at least one additional agent, in milliseconds.

perview_duration.description: The amount of time an agent spent previewing an engagement, in milliseconds.

conference_duration.description: The amount of time an agent spent in conversation with an engagement and at least one additional agent, in milliseconds.

conference_count.description: The number of conferences that occured.

hold_duration.description: The amount of time that a consumer was placed on hold, in milliseconds. NOTE: A call may have multiple hold times.

wrap_up_duration.description: The amount of time agents spent completing engagement wrap-up, in milliseconds.

inbound_handled_count.description: The number of inbound engagements offered to and answered by an agent.

outbound_handle_duration.description: The amount of time an agent spent handling an outbound engagement, in milliseconds.

warm_conference_duraton.description: The amount of time spent on warm conferences, in milliseconds.

warm_transfer_duration.description: The amount of time spent on warm transfers, in milliseconds.

ring_duration.description: The amount of time between when an engagement is assigned to an agent and the agent answered, missed, or declined the engagement, in milliseconds.

agent_first_response_duration.description: The amount of time it takes for an agent working a messaging channel to send the first message to a customer, in milliseconds.

dial_duration.description: The amount of time spent dialing the customer, in milliseconds.

inbound_conversation_duration.description: The amount of time that an agent spent on an inbound engagement in communication with the consumer, in milliseconds.

inbound_handle_duration.description: The amount of time an agent spent handling an inbound engagement, in milliseconds.

outbound_handled_count.description: The number of outbound engagements offered to and answered by an agent.

outbound_conversation_duration.description: The amount of time that an agent spent on an outbound engagement communicating with a consumer, in milliseconds.

first_offered_queue_duration.description: The amount of time an engagement toke from entering the Contact Center until it was assigned to the first queue.

duration_to_first_handled_queue.description: The amount of time from when engagements entered the flow until they were handled by the first assigned queue, in milliseconds.

duration_to_first_offered_agent.description: The amount of time from when engagements entered the flow until they were assigned with an agent, in milliseconds.

duration_to_first_handled_agent.description: The amount of time from when engagements entered the flow until they were handled by the first assigned agent, in milliseconds.

get.summary: List historical outbound dialer performance dataset data
get.description:
Generate a list of outbound dialer performance dataset raw data.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_report:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:read:dataset_outbound_dialer_performance:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start time and date in `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` format to pull the outbound dialer engagements that started after this date and time. The response only includes one month's worth of data. If there is no specified start date, the API returns data from the past 24 hours.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
Required only when the `from` parameter is specified. The end time and date in `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` format, the same format as the `from` parameter.
Pulls the outbound dialer engagements that started in the given `from` and `to` time periods.

to.description:

engagement_duration.description: The total duration of the engagement. From when the engagement starts ringing until it is hung up, in milliseconds.

response_duration.description: The amount of time the dialer takes to connect an agent to a live call after the customer answers the phone, in milliseconds.

direction.description:
The queue task direction.
* inbound
* outbound

queue_offered_count.description: The number of engagements routed into the queue for agents to answer.

abandoned_count.description: The number of times an end user abandoned an engagement before connecting with an agent. Also the sum of Short Abandons and Long Abandons.

short_abandons_count.description: The number of engagements that were abandoned before the threshold defined for the queue.

long_abandons_count.description: The number of engagements that were abandoned after the threshold defined for the queue.

overflow_count.description: The number of engagements that entered and left a queue without being answered.  This occurs because the capacity of available agent resources in queue was exceeded.

inbound_handled_count.description: The number of inbound engagements offered to and answered by an agent.

in_queue_wait_duration.description: The amount of time the consumer spent waiting live - not in callback - in the queue before the engagement was answered, overflowed, or abandoned, in milliseconds.

abandon_duration.description: The amount of time a customer waited in a specific queue before abandoning the engagement. Only applies to the queue where the abandonment actually occurred, in milliseconds.

speed_of_answer_duration.description:
The amount of time an engagement waited in the queue before an agent answered, in milliseconds.
NOTE: This metric does not include engagements that agents did not answer.

inbound_handle_duration.description: The amount of time agents spent handling inbound engagements, in milliseconds.

inbound_conversation_duration.description: The amount of time that an agent spent on an inbound engagement in communication with the consumer, in milliseconds.

inbound_wrap_up_duration.description: The amount of time an agent spent completing inbound engagement wrap-up, in milliseconds.

outbound_count.description: The number of outbound engagements that entered a queue, regardless of a successful connection.

outbound_handled_count.description: The number of outbound engagements handled by agents, regardless of successful connection or not.

outbound_connected_count.description: The number of outbound engagements that resulted in a successful connection between a customer and an agent.

outbound_dial_duration.description: The amount of time spent dialing the customer, in milliseconds.

outbound_handle_duration.description: The amount of time agents spent handling outbound engagements. This also includes the time dialing a customer, in milliseconds.

outbound_conversation_duration.description: The amount of time that an agent spent on an outbound engagement communicating with a consumer, in milliseconds.

outbound_wrap_up_duration.description: The amount of time an agent spent completing outbound engagement wrap-up, in milliseconds.

callback_registered_count.description: The number of engagements that entered the queue and requested a callback, or scheduled a callback via the dedicated web page.

callback_abandoned_count.description: The number of callbacks where an agent was already connected, but not successfully connected to the consumer.

callback_canceled_count.description: The number of callbacks which consumers choose to cancel and instead wait in the queue.

callback_timeout_count.description: The number of callbacks placed but did not speak to an agent before the callback expired.

callback_handled_count.description: The number of callbacks accepted by available agents.

callback_wait_duration.description: The amount of time from a callback being registered until either the agent calls back, the callback expires, or the callback is canceled, in milliseconds.

callback_pending_duration.description: The amount of time from when the agent called back until the customer answered the call, customer did not answer or the agent hung up, in milliseconds.

callback_handle_duration.description: The amount of time agents spent handling callbacks, in milliseconds.

callback_conversation_duration.description: The amount of time that an agent spent on an engagement communicating with a consumer, in milliseconds.

callback_wrap_up_duration.description: The amount of time agents spent completing after call work, in milliseconds.

handle_count.description: The number of inbound (including callback) and outbound engagements handled by the queue.

hold_count.description: The number of times that a consumer was placed on hold.

warm_transfer_initiated_count.description: The number of voice or video engagements an agent answered and then warm transferred with another participant with or without fully transferring the engagement.

warm_transfer_completed_count.description: The number of voice or video engagements an agent answered and then warm transferred with another participant and then fully transferred the engagements.

direct_transfer_count.description: The number of direct transfers initiated.

transfer_initiated_count.description: The number of transfers an agent initiated, including warm and direct transfers for voice and video channels, and all transfers for messaging and email channels (no distinction between warm and direct).

transfer_completed_count.description: The number of transfers an agent completed, including warm and direct transfers for voice and video channels, and all transfers for messaging and email channels (no distinction between warm and direct).

warm_conference_count.description: The number of warm conferences initiated.

conference_count.description: The number of conferences that occurred.

auto_close_disconnect_count.description: The count of messaging and email engagements that are auto closed by the system after not receiving a response from the consumer after a defined period of time.

handle_duration.description: The amount of time agents spent handling engagements, in milliseconds.

conversation_duration.description: The amount of time that agents spent on engagements communicating with a consumer, in milliseconds.

wrap_up_duration.description: The amount of time agents spent completing engagement wrap-up, in milliseconds.

hold_duration.description: The amount of time that a consumer was placed on hold, in milliseconds. NOTE: A call may have multiple hold times.

conference_duration.description: The amount of time an agent spent in conversation with an engagement and at least one additional agent, in milliseconds.

warm_transfer_duration.description: The amount of time an agent spent in conversation with another agent while the engagement was on hold, in milliseconds.

warm_conference_duration.description: The amount of time an agent spent in conversation with another agent while the engagement was on hold, in milliseconds.

get.description:
Retrieve a list of all historical engagement log data. The log captures all details of closed engagements, including a timeline and key events, providing a clear record for tracking and analysis.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_report:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:read:engagement_log:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

The default is UTC.

parameters.name: start_time_from
parameters.description: The start time to pull the engagement logs that began after this date and time. The response only includes one month's worth of data. If there is no specified start date, the API returns data from the past 24 hours.

parameters.name: start_time_to
parameters.description:
Required only when the `start_time_from` parameter is specified.
Pulls the engagement logs that started in the given `start_time_from` and `start_time_to` time periods.

parameters.name: end_time_from
parameters.description: The engagement end time to pull the engagement logs that ended after this date and time. The response only includes one month's worth of data. If there is no specified start date, the API returns data from the past 24 hours.

parameters.name: end_time_to

Required only when the `end_time_from` parameter is specified.
Pulls the engagement logs that started in the given `end_time_from` and `end_time_to` time periods.

The name of the channels on the Zoom platform.
* voice
* video
* messaging
* email

channel_source.description:
The name of sources on the Zoom platform that specifically relate to a channel.
- `voice` - Only applies to voice channel.
- `in_app_video` - Only applies to video channel.
- `kiosk_video` - Only applies to video channel.
- `web_video` - Only applies to video channel.
- `in_app_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel.
- `in_video_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel.
- `web_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel.
- `sms` - Only applies to messaging channel.
- `facebook_messenger` - Only applies to messaging channel.
- `instagram` - Only applies to messaging channel.
- `team_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel.
- `whatsapp` - Only applies to messaging channel.
- `email_address` - Only applies to email channel.

queues.description: All queues related to the engagement.

call_queues.description:
A list of **Call Queue** information. In Zoom Phone, this represents a group of phone users or common-area phones configured to handle incoming calls using defined distribution strategies such as simultaneous or round robin.

When integrated with Contact Center, a call queue can be designated as a routing target for Contact Center voice flows, enabling Contact Center interactions to be processed through your Phone call queue infrastructure.

extension_name.description: The Zoom Phone call queue name.

extension_number.description: The Zoom Phone extension number, such as 32784.

items.description: The Zoom Phone call queue information.

zoom_phone_users.description:
A list of **Zoom Phone User** information, representing an individual extension-enabled user.
    In integrated Zoom Contact Center scenarios, phone users can act as contact-center agents or recipientseither receiving calls directly transferred from Zoom Contact Center or functioning as members of call queues or auto receptionist routes.

shared_line_groups.description:
A list of **Shared Line Group** information. This allows multiple phone users or common-area phones to share a phone number and voicemail inbox. Zoom Phone admins can apply business hours and routing rules to these groups.
    When used with Zoom Contact Center, shared line groups can be selected as voice-flow targetscalls reaching the shared number are processed by any group member.

extension_name.description: The Zoom Phone share line group name.

items.description: The Zoom Phone shared line group information.

auto_receptionists.description:
A list of **Auto Receptionist** information. It answers incoming calls with a greeting or IVR menu and routes them to destinations such as phone users, call queues, common areas, voicemail, or an IVR system.

With Contact Center integration, auto receptionists often serve as entry points into Contact Center voice flows, directing callers into Contact Center handling.

items.description: The Zoom Phone auto receptionist information.

common_areas.description:
A list of **Common Areas** information, it typically deployed in shared office spaces like lobbies or conference rooms.
    These devices can be members of call queues, shared line groups, or receive calls via auto receptionist.
    In Zoom Contact Center enabled environments, common-area extensions may also serve as caller IDs or routing targets within Contact Center flows.

items.description: The Zoom Phone common area information.

zoom_rooms.description:
A list of **Zoom Room** information. Each represents a Zoom Room or standards-based SIP/H.323 room, like Cisco/Polycom, licensed for Zoom Phone.

These rooms can make and receive phone calls using Zoom Phone services. When integrated with Contact Center, Zoom Rooms can be used as call destinations, entry points, or agent endpoints within Contact Center voice flows.

inter_ops.description:
A list of **Interoperability Operation** information, representing standards-based SIP/H.323 room systems (e.g., Cisco Room, Polycom Room)
    integrated with Zoom through the Conference Room Connector.
    These devices are equipped with Zoom Phone calling capabilities, allowing them to make and receive phone calls.
    In Contact Center scenarios, interop rooms may serve as voice-flow targets or conferencing endpoints, enabling seamless integration of third-party hardware into Contact Center workflows.

items.description: The Zoom Phone and Contact Center call journey information.

timezone.description: The [timezone ID](/docs/api/references/abbreviations/#timezones) to use for the start time and end time in the query. The default is UTC.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

get.description:
Retrieve the Zoom Contact Center management system operation logs report. 

 The Zoom Contact Center management system operation logs report lets account owners and admins view monthly Zoom Contact Center related admin operation details.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_operation_logs:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:read:operation_logs:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start time and date in `yyyy-mm-dd` format. The date range defined by the `from` and `to` parameters should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data at once. If unspecified, returns data within the past 24 hours.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: **Required** only when specifying the `from` parameter. The end time and date in `yyyy-mm-dd` format, the same format as the `from` parameter.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter the response by the category of the action performed. By default, the value of this field is `all`, and the response includes a log of all operations for the defined period. To only include responses for a specific category type, provide a value for the category from [this table](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/contact-center-api/contact-center-operation-categories/).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Filter responses according to the type of operation performed. The value of this field is `all`, and the response includes a log of all operations for the defined period.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Filter responses according to `objectName` and operator. The default value is empty, which queries all data.

agent_first_response_duration.description: The amount of time it takes for an agent working a messaging channel to send the first message to a customer, in seconds.

ring_duration.description: The amount of time it takes for an agent to answer the engagement, in seconds.

conversation_duration.description: The amount of time an agent spent in active conversation with an engagement for any channel, in seconds.

conference_duration.description: The amount of time spent on conferences, including multiple confernces, in seconds.

warm_transfer_initiated.description: The number of engagements an agent answered and then warm transferred with another participant with or without fully transferring the engagement.

warm_transfer_completed.description: The number of engagements an agent answered and then warm transferred with another participant and then fully transferred the engagements.

warm_transfer_duration.description: The amount of time spent on warm transfers, in seconds.

direct_transfer.description: The indicator to determine if an agent initiated a direct transfer.

transferred_initiated.description: The number of transfers an agent initiated, including warm and direct transfers for voice and video channels, and all transfers for messaging and email channels with no distinction between warm and direct transfers.

transferred_completed.description: The number of transfers an agent completed, including warm and direct transfers for voice and video channels, and all transfers for messaging and email channels with no distinction between warm and direct transfers.

wrap_up_duration.description: The amount of time agents spent completing engagement wrap-up, in seconds.

agent_end_time.description: The agent leg ending date and time in ISO 8601 format, either yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssTZD.

200.description:

 Historical detail reports list returned.

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

timezone.description: The call's [timezone ID](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/other-references/abbreviation-lists/#timezones). The default is **UTC**.

from.description: The start time and date in **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, it returns data from the past 24 hours.

to.description: **Required** only when the `from` parameter is specified. The end time and date in **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format, the same format as the `from` parameter.

details.description: The information about the historical detail reports.

channel_source.description:
The channel's source. 
* `in_app_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel.  
* `web_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel. 
* `sms` - Only applies to messaging channel.
* `facebook_messenger` - Only applies to messaging channel.
* `whatsapp` - Only applies to messaging channel.
* `email_address` - Only applies to email channel.

consumer_id.description: The consumer's ID, for video and chat and email.

consumer_name.description: The consumer's name, for video and chat and email.

consumer_country_name.description: The consumer's number [country name](/docs/api/references/abbreviations/#countries), for voice and SMS.

consumer_country_code.description: The consumer's number [country name](/docs/api/references/abbreviations/#countries), for voice and SMS.

start_time.description: The engagement's starting date and time in ISO 8601 format, either `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` or `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssTZD`.

total_duration.description: The engagement's maximum agent duration, in seconds.

ivr_duration.description: The engagement's IVR duration, in seconds.

waiting_duration.description: The engagement's waiting duration, in seconds.

talking_duration.description: The engagement's talking duration, in seconds.

hold_duration.description: The engagement's hold duration, in seconds.

wrap_up_duration.description: The engagement's wrap-up duration, in seconds.

total_flow_duration.description: The total time of engagement's flows, in seconds.

queue_wait_type.description: The queue's wait type. Applicable to voice channels.

agent_first_message_speed.description: The engagement's initial response time, in seconds.

dialed_numbers.description: The dialed numbers. Applicable to voice, video, and SMS channels.

callback_waiting_duration.description: The callback waiting duration, in seconds. Applicable to voice channels.

callback_pending_duration.description: The callback pending duration, in seconds. Applicable to voice channels.

handling_duration.description: The handling duration, in seconds. Applicable to voice channels.

ring_duration.description: The ring duration, in seconds. Applicable to voice and video channels.

required_skills.description: The required skill names. Applicable to voice channels.

minimum_proficiency_level.description: The skill category's minimum proficiency level.

optional_skills.description: The optional skill names. Applicable to voice channels.

agent_skills.description: The agent skill names. Applicable to voice channels.

items.description: The information about the historical detail report.

get.summary: List historical agent reports by queue
get.description:
Generate detailed historical reports of agents from a specific queue.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_report:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:read:agent_report:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The call's timezone ID. The default is UTC.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start time and date in `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, return data from the past 24 hours.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Required only when the `from` parameter is specified. The end time and date in `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` format, the same format as the `from` parameter.

parameters.name: cc_queue_id
parameters.description: A Contact Center queue ID to query.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: The task's channel. Provides only a single channel.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The historical queue report's interval.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items returned per page.

200.description:
HTTP Status Code: 200

Historical queue's agents report list returned.

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

timezone.description: The call's timezone ID. The default is UTC.

from.description: The start time and date in `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, return data from the past 24 hours.

to.description: Required only when the `from` parameter is specified. The end time and date in `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` format, the same format as the `from` parameter.

offers_total.description: Offers happen every time an agent is presented with a call. An engagement can have multiple offers.

offers_acd.description: Offers ACD metric indicates presented to the agent via the queue distribution.

offers_non_acd.description: Offers Non-ACD that are presented to the agent bypassing the queue, or manually assign the engagement to a queue agent.

offers_answered.description: The number of engagements assigned to the agent that were answered.

offers_answered_acd_inbound.description: The number of inbound engagements assigned to the agent that were answered.

offers_missed.description: The number of engagements assigned to the agent that went unanswered, including cases where the agent timed out or the customer abandoned.

offers_declined.description: The number of inbound engagements declined by the associated member. In other words, they clicked the option to decline the engagement in the inbound call notification.

total_transferred_in.description: Transferred in metric indicates how many calls were routed to the queue because of the transfer. Transferred in = Transferred in to Queue + Transferred in to Agent.

total_transferred_out.description: How many of the calls answered by the agent were transferred out by the agent (instead of being completed by the agent or being abandoned while on hold).

hold_hang_up.description: Hold Hang Up that are presented how many engagements were hanged up by the consumer while on hold with the agent.

upgraded_to_video_call.description: How many voice calls were upgraded to video by the agent.

total_inbound_handling_duration.description: Total inbound handling duration. Handling duration = talking duration (hold duration included) + wrap-up Duration

average_inbound_handling_duration.description: Average inbound handling duration. Handling duration = talking duration (hold duration included) + wrap-up Duration.

longest_inbound_handling_duration.description: Maximum inbound handling duration. Handling duration = talking duration (hold duration included) + wrap-up Duration.

average_inbound_answer_duration.description: The average time that consumers spent talking to an agent. Talking duration includes talking time and hold duration.

total_inbound_answer_duration.description: The total time that consumers spent talking to an agent. Talking duration includes talking time and hold duration.

longest_inbound_answer_duration.description: The maximum amount of time it takes for an agent to answer the inbound engagement. It is from the system assigning the call to the agent and before the agent answers.

total_inbound_ring_duration.description: The total amount of time it takes for an agent to answer the inbound engagement. It is from the system assigning the call to the agent and before the agent answers

average_inbound_ring_duration.description: The average amount of time it takes for an agent to answer the inbound engagement. It is from the system assigning the call to the agent and before the agent answers

longest_inbound_ring_duration.description: The maximum amount of time it takes for an agent to answer the inbound engagement. It is from the system assigning the call to the agent and before the agent answers.

total_inbound_hold_duration.description: The total amount of time that a consumer was placed on hold during the inbound engagement.

average_inbound_hold_duration.description: The average amount of time that a consumer was placed on hold during the inbound engagement.

longest_inbound_hold_duration.description: The maximum amount of time that a consumer was placed on hold during the inbound engagement.

total_inbound_wrap_up_duration.description: The total amount of time that an agent spent in the wrap-up period.

average_inbound_wrap_up_duration.description: The average amount of time that an agent spent in the wrap-up period.

longest_inbound_wrap_up_duration.description: The maximum amount of time that an agent spent in the wrap-up period.

total_outbound.description: How many outbound calls did the agent participate in (callbacks are not considered outbound calls).

short_outbound.description: How many of the agent's outbound calls had a duration short than the long call threshold for the queue.

long_outbound.description: How many of the agent's outbound calls had a duration longer than the long call threshold for the queue.

hangup_outbound.description: How many of the agent's outbound calls had a duration shorter than the hang-up threshold for the queue.

total_outbound_ring_duration.description: The total amount of time that agents wait for their outbound engagement to be answered.

average_outbound_ring_duration.description: The average amount of time that agents wait for their outbound engagement to be answered.

longest_outbound_ring_duration.description: The maximum amount of time that agents wait for their outbound engagement to be answered.

total_outbound_handling_duration.description: The total outbound handling duration. Handling duration = talking duration (hold duration included) + wrap-up Duration.

average_outbound_handling_duration.description: Average outbound handling duration. Handling duration = talking duration (hold duration included) + wrap-up Duration.

longest_outbound_handling_duration.description: The maximum outbound handling duration. Handling duration = talking duration (hold duration included) + wrap-up Duration.

total_outbound_answer_duration.description: The total time that consumers spent talking to an agent. Talking duration includes talking time and hold duration.

average_outbound_answer_duration.description: The average time that consumers spent talking to an agent. Talking duration includes talking time and hold duration.

longest_outbound_answer_duration.description: The maximum time that consumers spent talking to an agent. Talking duration includes talking time and hold duration.

total_outbound_wrap_up_duration.description: The total amount of time that an agent spent in the wrap-up period.

average_outbound_wrap_up_duration.description: The average amount of time that an agent spent in the wrap-up period.

longest_outbound_wrap_up_duration.description: The maximum amount of time that an agent spent in the wrap-up period.

total_outbound_hold_duration.description: The total amount of time that a consumer was placed on hold during the outbound engagement.

average_outbound_hold_duration.description: The average amount of time that a consumer was placed on hold during the outbound engagement.

longest_outbound_hold_duration.description: The maximum amount of time that a consumer was placed on hold during the outbound engagement.

get.description:
Generate a list of historical queue reports. 

 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_report:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:read:queue_report:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items returned per page.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The call's timezone. The default is **UTC**.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, return data from the past 24 hours.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: **Required** only when the `from` parameters is specified. The end time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format, the same format as the `from` parameter.

parameters.name: queue_ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of queue IDs to query, up to 20 queue IDs.

parameters.name: cc_queue_ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of Contact Center queue IDs to query, up to 20 queue IDs.

parameters.name: channel_types
parameters.description: The channel's type. Provide only a single channel type.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description:
The task's channel. 
* `voice` 
* `video` 
* `messaging` 
* `email` 

Provide only a single channel. 

If channel is used as an input parameter, the deprecated parameter `channel_types` will not be processed.

parameters.name: channel_sources
parameters.description:
The channel's source. 
* `in_app_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel.  
* `web_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel. 
* `sms` - Only applies to messaging channel. 
* `facebook_messenger` - Only applies to messaging channel. 
* `whatsapp` - Only applies to messaging channel. 
* `email_address` - Only applies to email channel. 

Provide multiple channel_sources

get.description:
Generate a list of a historical queue's agent reports.  

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_report:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:read:agent_report:admin`

parameters.name: queueId
parameters.description: Supports both the routing queue ID and the Contact Center queue ID.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items returned per page.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The call's timezone. The default is **UTC**.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format. The defined date range should be a month, as the response only includes one month's worth of data. If no start date is specified, return data from the past 24 hours.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: **Required** only when the `from` parameters is specified. The end time and date in **yyyy-mm-dd** or **yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'** format, the same format as the `from` parameter.

parameters.name: channel_types
parameters.description: The channel's type. Provide only a single channel type.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description:
The task's channel. 
* `voice` (deprecated)
* `video` 
* `messaging` 
* `email` 

Provides only a single channel. 

If channel is used as an input parameter, the deprecated parameter `channel_types` will not be processed.

parameters.name: channel_sources
parameters.description:
The channel's source. 
* `in_app_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel.  
* `web_chat` - Only applies to messaging channel. 
* `sms` - Only applies to messaging channel. 
* `facebook_messenger` - Only applies to messaging channel. 
* `whatsapp` - Only applies to messaging channel. 
* `email_address` - Only applies to email channel. 

Provide multiple channel_sources

items.description:
[These permissions](https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0061941#h_01FWHA20K7CF310WJB29QXMNKC) control access to various analytics and reporting features, including real-time analytics, historical reports, and user activity tracking.
| Privileges | Description |
| :------ | :------ |
| `RptMyAgents:Read` | Allow user to view the status of agents. |
| `RptQueueAnalytics:Read` | Allow user to view real-time charts. |
| `RptQueueAnalyticsOverview:Read` | Allow user to view overview data for all channels. |
| `RptActiveChannelEngagements:Read` | Allow user to view active engagements for each channel. |
| `RptWallboard:Read` | Allow user to view wallboards. |
| `RptWallboard:Edit` | Allow user to add new wallboard views, duplicate existing ones and edit them. |
| `RptWallboardShare:Edit` | Allow user to share the wallboard views they create. |
| `RptAgentReport:Read` | Allow user to view agents timesheets. |
| `RptAgentReportOverview:Read` | Allow user to view overview data for all channels. |
| `RptAgentReportExport:Edit` | Allow user to export agent time sheet data. |
| `RptQueueChartReport:Read` | Allow user to view historical queue charts. |
| `RptQueueChartReportOverView:Read` | Allow user to view overview data for all channels. |
| `RptQueueChartReportExport:Edit` | Allow user to export queue chart data. |
| `RptQueueDetailReport:Read` | Allow user to view historical queue details. |
| `RptQueueDetailReportExport:Edit` | Allow user to export queue detail data. |
| `RptQueueIntervalReport:Read` | Allow user to view the interval report. |

| `RptFlowChartReportExport:Edit` | Allow user to export flow chart data. |
| `RptFlowDetailReport:Read` | Allow user to view the flow detail report. |
| `RptFlowDetailReportExport:Edit` | Allow user to export flow detail data. |
| `RptSurvey:Read` | Allow user to view the consumer engagement surveys report. |
| `RptSurveyExport:Edit` | Allow user to export engagement survey results. |
| `RptSubscriptions:Read` | Allow user to create or view subscriptions. |
| `RptCustomReports:Read` | Allow user to view existing reports (including default reports). |
| `RptCustomReports:Edit` | Allow user to create and duplicate reports. |
| `RptCustomReportsShare:Edit` | Allow user to share default and custom reports with your organization. |
| `RptCustomReportsExport:Edit` | Allow user to export default and custom reports. |

[These permissions](https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0061941#h_01GMEG7MDSBBXS4NSBME5617YX) control access to user and team management, as well as queue management, log management, etc.
| Permission Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| UserManagement:Read, UserManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage users. |
| TeamManagement:Read, TeamManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage teams. |
| RoleManagement:Read, RoleManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage roles. |
| SkillManagement:Read, SkillManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage skills. |
| InboxManagement:Read, InboxManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage inboxes. |
| QueueManagement:Read, QueueManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage queues. |
| NumberManagement:Read, NumberManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage numbers. |
| RoutingProfileManagement:Read, RoutingProfileManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage routing profiles. |
| DispositionManagement:Read, DispositionManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage dispositions. |
| WaitingRoomManagement:Read, WaitingRoomManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage waiting rooms. |
| FlowManagement:Read, FlowManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage flows in flow editor. |
| PreferenceManagement:Read, PreferenceManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage account preferences. |
| AddressBookManagement:Read, AddressBookManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage address books. |
| AddressCustomFieldManagement:Read, AddressCustomFieldManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage address book custom fields. |
| CampaignManagement:Read, CampaignManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage web campaigns. |
| IntegrationManagement:Read, IntegrationManagement:Edit | Allow user to view and manage integrations. |
| RoutingEngineManagement:Read, RoutingEngineManagement:Edit | Allow user to view Routing Engine console. |
| LogManagement:Read | Allow user to view and manage logs. |
| EngagementLogManagement:Read | Allow user to view the engagement log. |
| EngagementLogExport:Edit | Allow user to export engagement log data. |
| EngagementLogErasePII:Edit | Allow user to erase personal information in the engagement log. |
| VoiceCallLogManagement:Read | Allow user to view the voice calls log. |
| VoiceCallLogExport:Edit | Allow user to export voice calls log data. |
| SMSLogManagement:Read | Allow user to view the SMS log. |
| SMSLogExport:Edit | Allow user to export SMS log data. |
| RecordingsLogManagement:Read | Allow user to view the recordings log. |
| RecordingsLogExport:Edit | Allow user to export recordings log data. |
| VariablesLogManagement:Read | Allow user to view the variables log. |
| VariablesLogExport:Edit | Allow user to export variables log data. |
| VariablesLogDelete:Edit | Allow user to permanently delete engagement variables. |
| VoiceRecordingAccess:Read | Allow user to view list of Cobrowse recordings. |
| RecordingPlay:Edit | Allow user to play voice, video and messaging Cobrowse recordings. |
| VoiceRecordingDownload:Edit | Allow user to download voice, video and messaging Cobrowse recordings. |
| VoiceRecordingDelete:Edit | Allow user to delete voice, video and messaging Cobrowse recordings. |
| VoiceDataRetentionExemption:Edit | Allow user to manage data retention exemption for recordings. |

[These permissions](https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0061941#h_01FWHA20K7CF310WJB29QXMNKC) control access to start various types of outbound engagements, engagement features, client customization features, etc.
| Permission Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| OutboundVoiceCall | Allow user to start a new outbound voice engagement to consumer(s). |
| OutboundVideoCall | Allow user to start a new outbound video engagement to consumer(s). |
| OutboundSMS | Allow user to start a new outbound messaging engagement to consumer(s). |
| OutboundEmail | Allow user to start a new outbound email engagement to consumer(s). |
| QueueOptInOut | Allow user to opt in or out of their assigned queues. |
| OtherUserQueueOpt | Allow user to opt other users in or out of their assigned queues. |
| ChangeUserStatus | Allow user to change the Ready/Not Ready status of other users. |
| ContactManagement | Allow user to add or edit contacts information in the client. |
| VoicemailManagement | Allow user to view and manage the voicemails. |
| VoicemailPlay | Allow user to play voicemails. |
| VoicemailDownload | Allow user to download voicemails. |
| VoicemailAssign | Allow user to assign voicemail to others. |
| VoicemailDelete | Allow user to delete voicemails. |
| OwnCallRecordingView | Allow user to view and play their own voice, video and messaging Cobrowse recordings. |
| MessagingTranscript | Allow user to access the list of messaging transcript. |
| MessagingTranscriptDelete | Allow user to delete messaging transcript. |
| MessagingTranscriptDownload | Allow user to download messaging transcript. |
| EmailTranscript | Allow user to access the list of email transcript. |
| EmailTranscriptDelete | Allow user to delete email transcript. |
| EmailTranscriptDownload | Allow user to download email transcript. |
| ConsumerHistory | Allow user to view consumer history under profile in the client. |
| EngagementNote | Allow user to add or edit notes while in an engagement. |
| FileShare | Allow user to send and receive files in messaging and email engagements. |
| EngagementUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to voice or video calls. |
| ChatToVoiceUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to voice from Chat(web). |
| FacebookToVoiceUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to voice from Facebook Messenger. |
| SMSToVoiceUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to voice from SMS. |
| WhatsAppToVoiceUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to voice from WhatsApp. |
| InstagramToVoiceUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to voice from Instagram. |
| TeamChatToVoiceUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to voice from Zoom Team Chat. |
| ChatToVideoUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to video from Chat(web). |
| FacebookToVideoUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to video from Facebook Messenger. |
| SMSToVideoUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to video from SMS. |
| VoiceToVideoUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to video from Voice. |
| WhatsAppToVideoUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to video from WhatsApp. |
| InstagramToVideoUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to video from Instagram. |
| TeamChatToVideoUpgrade | Allow user to upgrade engagements to video from Zoom Team Chat. |
| VideoOnHold | Allow user to put video on hold. |
| EngagementTransfer | Allow user to transfer engagements to queues, flows and/or agents. |
| CobrowseSession | Allow user to start Cobrowse sessions during voice and web chat engagements. |
| WaitingRoomVideoDropIn | Allow user to talk with consumers on video while theyre in the waiting room. |
| WaitingRoomVideoChat | Allow user to chat with consumers on engagements while they wait. |
| EngagementListen | Allow user to listen in on engagements assigned to other agents. |
| EngagementWhisper | Allow user to whisper into engagements assigned to other agents. |
| EngagementBarge | Allow user to barge in on engagements assigned to other agents. |
| EngagementTakeover | Allow user to take over engagements assigned to other agents. |
| ActiveEngagements | Allow user to view and use Open engagements in the client. |
| ScheduledEngagements | Allow user to view and use Scheduled engagements in the client. |
| CompletedEngagements | Allow user to view and use Closed engagements in the client. |
| TeamTab | Allow user to view and use the Teams tab in the client. |
| AddressBookTab | Allow user to view and use the Address book tab in the client. |
| InboxTab | Allow user to view and use the Inbox tab in the client. |
| AnalyticsTab | Allow user to view and use the Analytics tab in the client. |

agent_routing_profiles.description: Information about the agent routing profiles.

agent_routing_profile_description.example: This is the agent routing profile's description.

wait_time_agent_in_seconds.description: Wait time for matched agent availability, in seconds. Set the minimum time before making an agent who matches the profile available for the queue.

priorities.description: The proficiency priority. The higher priority skill category - with proficiency based skills - takes precedence over those with lower priority. When comparing agents and all else is equal, the agents with the higher proficiency in the higher prioritized skill category should be considered for assignment.

priority_order.description: **Note** This field's values are ordered and unique.  This is the proficiency priority. The higher priority skill category - proficiency based skills - will take precedence over those with lower priority. When comparing agents and all else is equal, the agents with the higher proficiency in the higher prioritized skill category should be considered for assignment.

category_type.description:
The category's type. 

* `skill` - Skill category 
* `intent` - Intent group

skill_type.description:
The skill's type. Only applied when `category_type` is `skill`. 

* `text` - A text-based skill, such as a geographic location. Skills in this category do not have assigned skill levels. 
* `proficiency` - A proficiency-based skill, such as a second language. Skills in this category have assigned proficiency levels.

minimum_proficiency_level.description:
The skill's minimum proficiency level. 

**Note** Only applies to skill proficiency based skill categories. If minimum proficiency is set, agents must have a proficiency equal to or greater than the minimum proficiency value set.

skill_category_required.description: If a skill category is required, agents must have the corresponding skill or they will not be considered for assignment.

intent_group_required.description: If an intent group is required, agents must have the corresponding intent or they will not be considered for assignment.

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: agentRoutingProfileId
parameters.description: The agent routing profile's ID.

agent_routing_profile_description.example: This is the agent routing profile's description.

wait_time_agent_in_seconds.description: Wait time for matched agent availability, in seconds. Set the minimum time before making an agent who matches the profile available for the queue.

priorities.description: The proficiency priority. The higher priority skill category - with proficiency based skills - takes precedence over those with lower priority. When comparing agents and all else is equal, the agents with the higher proficiency in the higher prioritized skill category should be considered for assignment.

category_type.description:
The category's type. 

* `skill` - Skill category 
* `intent` - Intent group

skill_category_id.description: The skill category's ID. Required when `category_type` is `skill`.

intent_group_id.description: The intent group's ID. Required when `category_type` is `intent`.

minimum_proficiency_level.description: The skill's minimum proficiency level. **Note** Only applies to skill proficiency based skill categories. If minimum proficiency is set, agents must have a proficiency equal to or greater than the minimum proficiency value set. Only used when `category_type` is `skill`.

skill_category_required.description: If a category is required, agents must have the corresponding skill or they will not be considered for assignment. Required when `category_type` is `skill`.

intent_group_required.description: If an intent group is required, agents must have the corresponding intent or they will not be considered for assignment. Required when `category_type` is `intent`.

204.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `204`    Agent routing profile's details updated

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `4004`
Category doesn't exist.
**Error Code:** `4005`
Number of priorities exceeds maximum limit.
**Error Code:** `4006`
Category is duplicated in priorities.
**Error Code:** `300`
Missing required parameter.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found Agent routing profile doesn't exist.

409.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `409`
Conflict Agent routing profile's name already exists.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Return a list of consumer routing profiles.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center_routing_profile:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `contact_center:read:consumer_routing_profile:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: consumer_routing_profile_name
parameters.description: The consumer routing profile's name. Supports fuzzy search. This parameter requires encoding.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items returned per page.

200.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `200`    Consumer routing profile list returned.

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of all the records available across pages.

consumer_routing_profiles.description: Information about the consumer routing profiles.

consumer_routing_profile_description.example: This is the consumer routing profile's description.

top_priorities.description: The consumers' top priority. Decide the consumer's position in the queue. The higher the consumer's priority, the earlier the consumer will be served.

attribute_type.description:
The attribute's type.

* `address_book_contacts` - Address book contacts 
* `entrance_to_queue` - Entrance to queue 
* `new_customer` - New customer 
* `returning_customer` -  Returning customer 
* `release_to_queue` - Release to queue 
* `skills` - Skills 
* `address_book_variable` - Address book variable 
* `global_variable` - Global variable

ids.description:
The related entity ID list for priority's attribute. 
`address_book_contacts`
IDs - Address book contact ID list
`release_to_queue`
IDs - Queue ID list
`skills`
IDs - Skill ID list. Should under the same skill category.
`address_book_variable`
IDs - Address book ID list

enter_queue_start_time.description: The start time when the consumer enters the queue. Only used when `attribute_type` is `entrance_to_queue`.

enter_queue_end_time.description: The end time when the consumer enters the queue. Only used when `attribute_type` is `entrance_to_queue`.

enter_queue_timezone.description: The timezone when the consumer enters the queue. Only used when `attribute_type` is `entrance_to_queue`.

max_returning_minutes.description: Maximum number of minutes from last participation to now. Only used when `attribute_type` is `returning_customer`.

variable_id.description: The variable's ID. Only used when `attribute_type` is `global_variable` or `address_book_variable`.

variable_values.description: The optional variable's values. If variable matches any of them, it will match the priority. Only used when `attribute_type` is `address_book_variable`.

operator.description: The operator between global variable and `compared_value`. Only used when `attribute_type` is `global_variable`.

compared_value.description: Compare the specified value to the variable's value. Only used when `attribute_type` is `global_variable`.

accumulated_priorities.description: The consumers' accumulated priority. Use ratings to serve consumers from the highest to lowest value, from 100 to 1, based on a consumer attribute. Consumers accumulate priority while waiting in the queue, after top priority consumers.

attribute_type.description:
The attribute's type.

* `address_book_contacts` - Address book contacts 
* `entrance_to_queue` - Entrance to queue 
* `new_customer` - New customer 
* `returning_customer` -  Returning customer 
* `release_to_queue` - Release to queue 
* `skills` - Skills 
* `address_book_variable` - Address book variable 
* `global_variable` - Global variable

incremental_rate.description: The rate that consumers accumulate priority while waiting in line. For example, consumer A and consumer B have the same top priority. If consumer A.wait_time \* consumer A.`incremental_rate` > consumer B.wait_time \* consumer B.`incremental_rate`, consumer A will be first serviced.
